original_text: Great store with a lot of cool clothes! It is true with all the other reviews...the regular price clothing can be a lil steep but you have to check out the sales rack. I got a pair of J Brand Jeans that were originally 225 for only 68!!! I seriously should have considered buying two pairs! The customer service is really great and everyone is very helpful and finding your size and recommending items. If you're in the mall, be sure to just stop in and check out the sales section...definitely worth your time!

original_text: Not sure if this is just normal for a place that just opened but pretty much everything was bad for us. Too bright lighting, dirty seats, hard to read menus, bad salsa, weird chips, terrible margaritas, slow to no service (had to ask for someone to come to the table) 18 for fajitas that contained 6 small shrimp? 3 tiny tortillas with that? Yikes, won't be back...

original_text: It was a pampering experience but unless money is no object I wouldn't go for the food, which was fine but unremarkable. My hot smoked salmon would have passed for a tinned salmon if I hadn't known better, and I didn't like my crab cake which was gummy and needed a sauce. The prawns were tasty, but not that different from what I would get from Sainsbury's. The ambience was very nice. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. I liked the exposed brick and the large windows which let the light flood in, but it was not very busy and this is the second time I have been when there were very few diners. The kitchen is open and I have to say that it wasn't very busy there either. I had booked a manicure and pedicure which were very relaxing, and I was allowed to take my time. The nail polish was not as good as I had expected, however, and I had to re-do mine myself at home. I was given a glass of champagne when I booked, and a glass of Prosecco when I finished the pedicure. I would do this again, but I would go for the afternoon tea next time.
text: My friend and I went for the afternoon tea, and I have to say that it wasn't as good as I would have liked. I would do this again, but I would go for theafternoon tea next time.

Two stars for the large portions and pretty fast service, but it's not worth the calories. Go to PF Changs instead! Easy parking. Great place to take kids. Good food! Kids loved the fortune cookies! We were there for an evening meal and had a party of 14. The restaurant was very busy but we were seated quickly. They were very accommodating for my gluten-free daughter. The server was very attentive. The food was very good! I will definitely go back. The food was amazing and the service was great! We will definitely be back! The place is so clean and the staff is very helpful and nice. Food is always delicious. We had a party of 12 in a private room. The food was excellent. The room was perfect. The service was outstanding. The manager checked on us several times. The food was served hot and the portions were generous. We will return and would recommend to friends. The food was good but not the best Chinese food I've ever had. Not sure I would go out of my way to go there again.

original_text: Shelled out over 100 on the first night of our long awaited trip to Vegas. Thought it was pretty good, until the food poisoning hit the next day. Had to go to the emergency room at St Rose. You would think I'd learn by now not to eat hamburger from the cheap places in Vegas. Luckily, I got it on my insurance. I ended up spending a lot more in Vegas than I originally planned, but I made the best of it. Even got to go to the top of the Stratosphere. When we got back from Vegas, we had to go and buy a new toilet. I think it is the second time this year we've had to replace that toilet. It's a good thing we got a 10 year warranty on it. We can't be more than halfway through the warranty, though. It has been a really, really long year. The upstairs toilet also had a problem. After a few weeks of flushing it every hour or so, we decided to replace that toilet too. Hopefully, that will be the last of the toilets for a while. That's about it for the month. I'm going to be really busy next month. I have to take a week of vacation in the middle of the month, and the week after that, I have to take a three day trip to a client. I'm really dreading that trip, especially since I have to stay in a hotel. I hate hotels.

original_text: The place stinks of smoke like when it was the Imperial. The rooms are tiny. The WIFI works about half the time or less. The casino area is small, the food is so-so, and the shows are poor. The security is, in my opinion, over the top. Too many cameras. The smoke seems worse in the casino, and the WIFI is even worse. The RV park is about what you would expect at this price point. It is very close to the casino and the WIFI is actually better. The laundry is a bit out of date but works. The restaurant is a bit of a hike from the park and the choices are very limited. The security is probably just right for an RV park, and the people are nice. Low price but there is a reason for it. I'm a local and I've been to the RV park a few times. It's just a matter of convenience for me. There is not much room for dog walking so I use the hiking trails. I have never stayed at the RV park and it's nice but small and I'm sure that's why they make you move your trailer or RV to the dump station to get your holding tanks dumped. The casino has a great buffet that has improved a lot. I recommend the casino buffet to everyone. The casino has an event center that is nice and a few different restaurants inside. The price of the RV park is great and I like to support the casino.

original_text: I have been an avid Starbucks customer for many many years now, and I have traveled to Starbucks locations all across the country on business. As this location is close to where I work, I am forced to frequent it often. It has consistently been slow and the customer service is often as ghetto as the neighborhoods which surround it. This morning, I waited 20 minutes in line and found out that this is the ONLY Starbucks in the country that won't grind a bag of coffee beans because it is not Starbucks coffee. Well Starbucks, you've lost one more customer. I won't be visiting this location again.

original_text: Worst company out there. I live in a community managed by ACM and it's a joke. They are rude and anytime you have a problem or complaint and call about it, they don't want to hear it. They treat you like you're bothering them. They never return phone calls. They don't care about anything and have no regard for the residents. Don't waste your time with ACM! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! WORST PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANY EVER! We have had nothing but problems with this company since moving into a townhome. The last straw was when we found out that they were notified of a sewer issue within the townhome and told them that we had a sewer issue and the workers were not allowed to fix the issue because they would have to enter the neighbors house to fix the issue. They would not contact the owner. The sewer issue caused the toilet to overflow and we had to call a plumber out to fix it. The plumber called ACM and they STILL would not contact the owner. They said they would send someone out, they never did and this happened on a Friday. We had a plumber come out on a Saturday to fix the issue. They sent out someone on a Monday and he broke the toilet again. He did not fix the issue. ACM had to send someone out a second time to fix the issue. They charged us 450 for the fix. It was a 25 fix. We moved out because they are the worst and we wanted to get out of our lease. They wouldn't let us out of our lease because they said we were late on a payment. We were not late on the payment. Our payment was set up to come out on the 15th of the month. That is what we paid our rent on for the 12 months we lived there. ACM changed the date and we were not notified. We paid the rent on the 15th because that is what we had always paid it on. We didn't know that they changed the date. They tried to charge us 150 for late rent that we didn't owe and threatened to put us in collections if we didn't pay. We had to pay it because we had to move. It was the worst experience we have ever had. I will NEVER do business with them again. The ACM Group is an incredible property management company. Everyone from the office staff to the maintenance crew is always very professional, friendly and prompt to respond to any issues that arise. I have lived at their properties for over 8 years and couldn't be happier. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a great place to live!

The last straw was when we found out that they were notified of a sewer issue within the and told them that we had sewer issue and the workers were not allowed to fix the issue because they would have to enter the house to fix it.

original_text: Way too pricey!!! Not at all LA style pastramis.... Probably will be our first and last. Waiting forever right now for our food, it's a Sunday no one else in here so really?? Chocolate donut was delish! And the service was good. Food is really good and good value. We liked the environment and the staff were very nice. Had a great experience. The service was amazing, the food was delicious and the portions were very generous. My only complaint is that there were no vegan dessert options. The food was good but the place was a little too cramped for my liking. The staff seemed overworked. I ordered the house smoked salmon and it was great. The environment was really great and the staff were very friendly. The food was excellent and the service was great. The venue was very nice. Overall, it was a great experience.

original_text: Stayed here again because of the convenience to the light rail. My husband and I along with 2 friends had tickets to the George Strait concert and wanted to not have to fight traffic so we chose the Radisson. Check in was a breeze and the front desk clerk upgraded our rooms to Cabana suites...free of charge. Once again the room was extremely clean and had been recently updated. Brian down in the bar was great for happy hour..and he has a heavy pour. Check out the happy hour specials, they have a list of specialty martinis for 5. We love this location, sure it's off the beaten path and across the street from an adult bookstore but everyone is always friendly and pleasant and the property is taken care of and the best part it's 2 blocks from a light rail station. Catch it and enjoy a concert or sporting event downtown without the hassle or cost of parking.

original_text: We went here for a girls night out dinner. We ordered 4 different dishes and all of us commented that all of our dishes were very salty (sea bass, duck, swordfish). The service was mediocre- the waitress lacked emotions and her voice was so quiet we could barely hear her the whole time. As for the sides, the waitress asked what would you like for your side? to all of us, and we thought they were included in the meal. Later when we got the bill, we found out that the sides were about 10 each. No complaints, they probably will say it's your fault for not looking at the prices on the menu but we felt that she should've asked instead of sounding like she's offering sides. The restaurant does have a romantic vibe though- the interior was nice. However for a 250 bill without any drinks and 4 very salty dishes, I wouldn't come back.

original_text: This place is amazing! I have been on holidays and non-holidays and I think the holidays are much better overall. But that is not to say that non-holidays are bad but it is excellent on holidays and above average on other days. The pricing is rather high but it has quite a few amazing stations to choose from including the standards of beef, american, pasta, salads and deserts. If you wanted a place to compare it to I would say that Bellagio is definitely the inspiration for this place. And they are definitely comparable. The only downside to Wynn for me is consistency. Again if you go on a holiday the pricing is quite high but the food quality is also much higher such as the pure prime rib that they provide during the holidays, and fresh crab legs, and other delights. Definitely recommended if you are in Vegas and looking for something that is Bellagio level of taste and quality.

original_text: Congratulations to the Democratic party for being so divided that they can't even agree on a candidate to be considered for the general election. Nice job fellas. You're pushing a lot of people into the arms of the Republican party. Not that I'm complaining. The best thing about this particular battle for the nomination is the ammunition we're getting. The more Hillary and Obama fight, the more dirt is exposed. And I think it's fair game to use that dirt. It's not like they're not using it on each other. I've made it no secret that I despise Hillary Clinton. I really don't like her. I think she's a bitchy little sneak with too much power. If she's elected President, we're in big trouble. She's just as bad as her husband, if not worse. So, yes, I'm going to use the ammunition I'm being handed and do my best to make sure she doesn't get elected. The following video is, in my opinion, one of the most damning pieces of footage against her. And the fact that it was leaked from a debate that was supposed to be off-the-record is just icing on the cake. Pay close attention to the rhetoric she's using. And notice that she's saying this in public. She's obviously proud of it. I'm sure there are a lot of people out there who will tell me that I'm being unfair. But these are the tactics that Hillary Clinton employs when she wants to get something done. And that's the scariest part. The power that she has, and her willingness to use it to do what she wants. If you're a fan of Hillary's, this probably hasn't changed your mind. I understand that. She's pretty, and she says what you want to hear. But don't let that blind you to the fact that she's a power-hungry woman who will do whatever it takes to get her way. If you don't believe me, ask Bill. Ever since he's been out of office, he's been on a role. The man has been eating and drinking his way across the country. And let's be honest. The guy looks like shit. He looks old and bloated. I'm sure he doesn't feel good about himself. I bet the only time he feels good is when he's in the White House. I bet he misses the attention. I bet he misses feeling like the most powerful man in the world. I bet he misses Hillary. She's the reason he got into office. And she's the reason he stayed there. He owes everything to her. And I have a feeling he'll do anything to keep her in power. Labels: Hillary Clinton, politics, YouTube At Wednesday, February 06, 2008 8:24:00 PM, Heather said... I despise that woman as well, but I'll take her over Obama. At Wednesday, February 06, 2008 10:36:00 PM, Mr. Apron said... At Wednesday, February 06, 2008 11:56:00 PM, Nilsa SoMi Speaks said... I'm going to have to disagree with you here, not about Clinton, but about Obama. I think the two of them would make a great president and vice-president team. I think Obama could use a Clinton in his corner when it comes to getting the job done. I also think he could use Clinton's expertise when it comes to foreign policy. I know you're a staunch Republican, but if you don't think Obama has it in him to be a strong president, then you haven't been paying attention. He's got what it takes. As for this YouTube video, I don't think it says much about her, other than the fact that she's a woman who would do anything to get ahead. I think that's true of all women in positions of power. What woman hasn't been labeled a bitch in the workplace? At Thursday, February 07, 2008 9:35:00 AM, Chris said... Hey, I have no problem with the two of them running the country. I just want to make sure

But these are the tactics that Hillary Clinton employs when she wants to get something done. And that's the scariest part. The power that she has, and her willingness to use it to do what she wants. If you're a fan of Hillary's, this probably hasn't changed your mind. I understand that. She's pretty, and she says what you want to hear. But don't let that blind you to the fact that she's a power-hungry woman who will do whatever it takes to get her way. If you don't believe me, ask Bill. Ever since he's been out of office, he's been on a role. The man has been eating and drinking his way across the country. And let's be honest. The guy looks like shit. He looks old and bloated. I'm sure he doesn't feel good about himself. I bet the only time he feels good is when he's in the White House. I bet he misses the attention. original_text: Let me tell you a story about a casino being rebuilt and re-branded. They closed down, let everyone know that they were coming back better than ever next year, and then... didn't. The casino has been closed for about a year now, and the only signs of life are that a "For Lease" sign has gone up, and the power is back on. Everyone around here thought it was a scam to re-open the casino, but it's looking like the real story is that it's a scam to try to sell the place for development. The "No Trespassing" signs are a dead giveaway. There's a construction crew that's been using the place for their break room. They've got a bunch of old slot machines in there, so I can see the appeal. I was hoping to take a few pictures of the inside, but I didn't want to get locked up.
text: It's been a long time since I've been inside a casino, so I'm going to share a few pictures of what it's like to be inside.

original_text: I just wanted to write you to express my extreme disappointment in the Waterfront location. My granddaughter and I bought two mollies last night around 8-8:30pm last night. One of them died over night. When I took the dead fish back to the store to exchange it they gave me a hard time. Saying I needed a water sample. I told them I've bought many fish from them in the past and never had to bring in a water sample to exchange a fish. (I own two fish tanks. One 55 gallon and one 40 gallon). I wasn't asking for my money back, I just wanted another fish. They refuse and the manager walked away from me saying that's our policy. I got my money back for the fish, but they no longer have a customer. I also own a business in Homestead and would never treat my customers that way. Especially if I wanted to keep a good reputation. They have lost a customer who has spent hundreds of dollars at that location over a 4 fish. Here is the fish return policy they have listed online. No where does it say you need a water sample. Petco's commitment to our customers: All freshwater fish purchased at petco.com are guaranteed to stay alive for 30 days from the day they arrive at your home or we will gladly refund your money. All marine species, live rock and plants are guaranteed for 15 days from delivery. I will now have to drive 10 miles out of my way to another pet store, but they will NEVER see another dime from me. Hope that 4 fish that they probably paid 25 cents for was worth it!

original_text: We were in Vegas for the week for my daughter's wedding and wanted to try someplace different...not a chain, not on the strip, but great none the less....we found it in Viva Zapatas! We went on a Monday night, and made reservations since there were going to be about 10 of us. We only had to wait about 10 min. after we got there, no problems at all. It isn't very big, but it's decorated wonderfully and it doesn't feel crowded at all, just right. One thing I loved is that the entire time we were there there was a 1 man mariachi playing a guitar and singing live. I don't know if he is there all the time or not, but I loved it...just added to the ambiance. We ordered an appetizer of Queso Fundido con Chorizo in addition to the complimentary chips, salsa, and frijoles. Oh my goodness! It was the best, cheesiest, sausage-y goodness ever! Our table also ordered a pitcher of Cadillac Margs...the pitcher was more of a carafe, but the margs were delish! With 10 of us there were a variety of entrees ordered and everyone loved theirs. Mine was a cheese enchilada and chili relleno, both were delicious. Flan for dessert topped off the evening perfectly. When I'm in Vegas again I will definitely go back!

original_text: We stayed here for a bachelorette party during Labor Day weekend. We were 9 people in total, and wanted to be able to stay pretty much in a large suite without spending a fortune. Palms Place suited that bill nicely. While we'd originally booked a 2-bedroom suite and adjoining room, at check-in we upgraded to a penthouse suite and added a couple roll-away beds so we could all be in 1 room. Best decision we ever made, as it was only a couple hundred bucks more per night (split 9 ways, natch). Unfortunately for both us and the Palms Place staff, there were TONS of issues with the first suite they put us in. A couple girls got locked the master bath on at least 3 separate occasions, the hot tub on the balcony didn't work, the fireplace didn't work, and we didn't have an ice maker, just to name a few. After several unsuccessful repairs, the staff relented and relocated us to a bigger suite one level up for our last night. Then they gave us a hard time about getting additional roll-away beds so everyone had a place to sleep, which was unfortunate. While the problems with the rooms led to a less-than-ideal experience, we were all quite thrilled to be staying in a couple awesome suites, with a hot tub overlooking the Strip. Not too shabby, all things considered. While on future Vegas trips, I might opt to stay closer to the action, if ever I needed a single room for 6 people and didn't want to spend a fortune, Palms Place would be it.

original_text: The Two Stars are for the servers that try their best. This used to be my favorite place for all special occasions. Not anymore. I went their for my birthday, this past Saturday, Feb. 2nd, 2019. I had a reservation. It was my birthday. I was dressed nicely. I had my three year old with me. We are a party of 12, plus an infant. I called a few weeks before to let them know we are a large party. The day before the reservation, I called to confirm the reservation. I made sure to inform them that we are a large party. At 7:30pm, when we got there, we were told we would have to wait for a table for 20 minutes. There were three people in front of us. We waited 25 minutes. The host was sitting at the table next to us. My family was dressed nicely. I asked the host if I could have the table next to him because it's my birthday and I would like to sit there. I asked if he could move a few things so I can sit there. He told me they are saving that table for the band and that they are not ready yet. My family and I were sitting at the other table for 25 minutes. I asked him if I can have the table next to him. He refused and said that I cannot have it. There was a lot of empty tables. I asked the waiter to tell the manager that I would like the table next to the host and I asked him to bring me a dessert. After 15 minutes, we got our table. My dessert never came. When I asked, I was told that the manager has to approve it. The manager came and said he did not approve it. We ordered our food. My food came out cold. I asked the server if I could have a new order because it was cold. The manager came and said he could not replace my food because it was made the way it is supposed to be. I asked him what happened to my dessert. He said that he did not approve it. He told me that I cannot get a dessert because I had a reservation. I told him that I called to confirm my reservation and I asked him to tell me what is the difference between a reservation and a walk in. He told me that he cannot give me my dessert because I had a reservation. The manager was so rude. He told me that I cannot eat at his restaurant. He told me that I am too loud. My 3 year old was with me. I had a table of 12 and an infant. I have never been treated this way. I felt humiliated. I did not receive my dessert. I was charged for my cold food. I did not go to the restaurant to make a scene. I went there to have a nice time. All I wanted was a dessert. All he had to do is tell me sorry that I cannot give you a dessert because we are closing. This is not the first time I had issues with this restaurant. I went there a few months ago with my husband. We had a reservation. They seated us in a hallway. I asked the manager if I could have another table. He told me that we cannot sit anywhere else. I ended up leaving. I called to complain. The manager said that he did not say that. I have a voice recording of the conversation. I called the restaurant and spoke to the manager again. I spoke to him for a few minutes. He still did not apologize. He told me that he does not want my business and that he does not want to see me at his restaurant. I have never been treated this way before. I will not return to this restaurant. I will never recommend this restaurant. Sofia, what you experienced is atrocious and my heart goes out to you. You deserved better. Unfortunately, this is what happens when people become entitled, they don't realize how unreasonable their behavior is. It happens everywhere. I was recently at a restaurant (not Cuban) and a group of people came in. It was around 9:45 pm and they were not very happy that the waiter told them they could not order dinner. They were also drinking and yelling at the waiter. The manager got involved and tried to explain to them that he could not accommodate them since the kitchen was closed. They were not happy about it and they started to yell at him and told him that they were going to close his restaurant down. I was appalled at this behavior. If I had been the manager, I would have asked them to leave. Needless to say, they did not get their food. I felt so bad for the manager who was trying his best to please them.
text: In our series of letters from African-American journalists, novelist, and writer Ta-Nehisi Coates reflects on her time at The Two Stars restaurant in Washington, DC.

original_text: Woohoo, just love the food at CDC. Not your typical deli but deli style creations that are made with old style, with high quality wide range of cured meats that are sliced in front of you, depending on what you like or don't like. The shop is small but it has a great atmosphere. Really friendly staff and nothing is a problem. It's a cash only place so be prepared. Love the eggs benedict, the mushroom and the chorizo and potato hash. I love the breakfast options here, especially the eggs benedict. The other half loves the chorizo and potato hash. The cakes are to die for. Especially the carrot cake. I can't wait for the new restaurant to open up. We live in the area and love to pop into the CDC for a quick bite to eat or something to take home. The breakfasts are a must try. The chorizo potato hash is a winner, as is the eggs benedict. The staff are always so helpful and friendly. The cakes are to die for. Always look forward to the weekend to try something new. Nice food, fresh, well prepared. Service is friendly, they are happy to accommodate you. I have been there twice and both times have enjoyed it. I like the meat and cheese platter with bread and jam. Good food, good prices and the cheese is good. Service is a little slow but they are very friendly and helpful. Amazing service and food. I love the chorizo potato hash and the Italian style sausage. The cheeses are amazing. Well worth a visit, good food, good prices and the cheese is great.
text: The cured meats at CDC are of the highest quality and are made from scratch every day in-house, so you can be sure you're getting the best possible product.

original_text: Strike the background music by the Commodores, Three Times a Lady..."yes, you're once, twice, THREE times a laaaady. And I loooove youuuuu! Yep. After C4. After The Clarendon Kitchen. We now have Gallo Blanco. And I am muy happy about this. The carne asada tacos are heavenly! Perfectly seasoned and served in the cutest taco rack. I'm now combing every William Sonoma to find these puppies. Our mango fresco juice beverage thingie was so refreshing I wanted to jump right in! Rickie said the roasted chicken was succulent. Ok. So he didn't say succulent. I think yummy was the word. The decor is modern and comfortable. I love how they really opened up the room. It is light, airy and has great views. Including our bedroom window...ooops...maybe I shouldn't have mentioned that. OMG. We just confirmed our trip to Disney World! Gotta go! Oh. Eat here. NOW!

We have eaten at Eddie V's a number of times at the one in Boston and found it to be a very good restaurant. However, the one in San Antonio had a very disappointing menu. It was very limited in terms of options and they were rather expensive for what they were. The food was not as good as we had at the Boston location and the service was not as good either. The manager came over and asked how our experience was and I told him that we felt that they were a little over priced for what we received and that the menu was limited. His response was "Yeah, we really don't like that menu either." I don't know if this was his way of telling us that they were changing the menu or that he was being honest. I always go to Eddie V's when I'm in Dallas. I was disappointed to find that San Antonio didn't have the same menu. We have been here a couple of times for business. The first time, the food was great, the second time was not as good and the third time we were here for a large group. We ordered a lot of food, all of the lobster tails were over cooked and the server didn't seem to be too apologetic about it. The manager offered to take some off the bill but not as much as the lobster tails cost. We ordered desserts but only received a couple of them and were told that they would be out shortly. When we were done eating, the rest of the desserts hadn't arrived and the server never checked in with us. We told the manager that we didn't want the desserts since it had been over an hour. I won't go back. Food is always good but the service was the worst we have ever had. We waited 15 mins to get our drinks, then had to ask for bread, we waited 30 mins for the waiter to come back after we ordered. The food was good but the service is what you would expect for fast food. We just don't think we will go back. Our meal was delicious. The service was great and we had a nice view of the riverwalk. The food and the ambiance were great. The service was very poor. We waited almost an hour for dinner. There were only 2 other couples in the restaurant. The place was not busy. They did offer a free appetizer which helped. We will not return. We had a wonderful time. The service was great. The food was amazing. Food was good, I'd go back, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there. We had a great time. The food was amazing. The service was great. We will definitely go back. Would have been nice if I'd been informed that the restaurant was going to be closed after our party for a private event. We felt a bit rushed to finish our meal. Eddie V's always delivers a great meal and a great experience. This restaurant is out of our way and we don't make it very often. The food was fabulous, as always, but the service was poor. We arrived at 6:00, and were seated immediately. It took 20 minutes for a waiter to come to our table. When he did, he informed us that the table we were at was for a large party arriving at 7:30. He said he would try to get us out by 7:15. We told him that was fine. He then proceeded to take our order, which we thought was unusual since we hadn't even been given water. He did not offer to bring us a drink until I asked for one. Our drinks came after our meal arrived, and then he brought our side dishes. I had to ask him for a bread plate. After a few bites of our meal, I asked him for a knife. He took mine and said he would bring me a new one. He never brought one, and I had to ask again for one before he finally brought me one. He asked me for my fork and never brought me another one. The table next to us had a smoking section of their meal catch on fire, and it took the manager and another waiter a long time to put it out. We left before the

original_text: I've been to a few other places for dim sum, so my opinion is somewhat biased. For the record, I'm also your standard adventure-seeking gringo, inspired by Andrew Zimmern. So, the wife and I decided to check out Mekong for their dim sum brunch. Now, the prices are extremely fair. There are 4 pricing categories for their dim sum, A, B, C, and D. All choices A through C are priced at 2.18, while D is priced at 4.95. Sodas are sold by the can, so we chose to have one can each of cola and we shared a pot of tea. We're not picky, but we chose not to indulge on the lovely assortments of buntype dishes that were presented to us. Instead, we focused our attention and appetite on the pork, chicken, and seafood offerings. And boy, we were not disappointed with the food! Some of our treats included shrimp shumai, chicken and shrimp crispy spring rolls, pork spare ribs with black bean sauce (basically just a serving of pork fat with some bone in it, but incredibly tasty), taro cakes, sharkfin dumplings, and several others. The servers were attentive, wheeling their cars around to every occupied table in the establishment. Well, all the servers except for one. I couldn't help but notice that one server seemed to avoid our table. At first, I thought it was my imagination. But then my wife noticed. In fact, I watched her as she pushed her cart past us while making an effort to look in the opposite direction! Of course, her cart had the items we were most interested in, so we were quite disappointed by her. Were it not for that one server, we'd be giving our experience here 5 stars. I purposely struck up a conversation with one of the other servers, a very pleasant young man, who was managing a cart that had the words beef organs on the side. I asked him what he was offering, and when he described it to me, I could not conceal my interest. He joked with us that he didn't think we'd be interested in his dish. Well, he was half right....my wife didn't want anything to do with it! That plate was very interesting. It consisted of various organ meats, including tripe and liver that I could identify, and several others I could not. All of the meats were very soft and tender, which is unusual for organ meats. My wife even tried some (what a trooper). We should all be glad I'm the one writing this review:) Another of the dishes we tried was a flat noodle with shrimp. Slippery devils, these were! I was having such a hard time picking these up with chopsticks that one of the other wait staff was attentive enough to offer us forks. He did it so politely that we joked with him to feign our offense, but we were actually quite thankful. The place settings do not include forks (an indication of their cultural authenticity, perhaps?) Oh, be thankful that there is a menu with pictures of each offering. Most of the servers do not speak fluent English. But when you ask them what they are serving, they can point to the picture and you can read it yourself! Overall, a fun experience. Plenty of food, at bargain prices. And before you leave, be sure to take a stroll through Mekong Plaza (the grocery store next door) and take in all the exotic tasties they have to offer. It's not Lee Lee Market in its size or variety, but then it's also not as overwhelming.

original_text: Okay, the Hot and Ready deal is a joke. They never have the 5 pizzas ready, and there is always a wait. To top it off, the last three times I've been there the cashier's have been rude. It is a Pizza Hut, right? I expect good service and good food. I am not getting that. I would much rather take my money to Pizza Inn and get good service, a great pizza, and a wonderful experience. i was in there the other day, and was looking for the cheesy bread, but could not find it. i told the cashier i wanted 4 orders of cheesy bread, and the cashier said they don't have any. i thought to myself, they don't have any cheesy bread. i asked another cashier, she also said they don't have any, and it is their policy not to make any. I told her i want to talk to the manager, she said he was not there. I have been going to pizza hut for years, and this is the first time i have been to one that does not have cheesy bread. This pizza hut is terrible. They don't even carry the stuff that makes pizza hut pizza hut. I have never been in a pizza hut that did not have cheesy bread. i will never eat at this pizza hut again. original_text: We were in Vegas for the week for my daughter's wedding and wanted to try someplace different...not a chain, not on the strip, but great none the less....we found it in this little restaurant. We sat at the bar and were treated like family. Food was delicious and they treated us like we were family. We will go back every time we are in Vegas. Thanks for a great experience. I have been to Maxie's several times. I love the food, I love the atmosphere, and I love the service. The atmosphere is laid back, the food is excellent, and the service is fast, friendly, and efficient. I had the reuben and it was the best I have ever had. My husband had a delicious chicken pot pie. The service was fast, but not hurried. I will definitely come back! Great place with really good food, service was a little slow but we just got there in time for the rush. We will go back again. Love this place, good food and great service. Will be back for sure. This place is awesome. I had the burgers and they were so good. The waitress was so nice and attentive. I would definitely go back. We have been going to Maxie's for years. They have a great menu with a lot of delicious choices. The service is always fast and friendly. The location is convenient and there is usually parking in the back. If you are looking for a place to hang out, have a beer, have some great food and make new friends this is the place for you. We have been going there for years. They have a great menu with a lot of delicious choices. The service is always fast and friendly. The location is convenient and there is usually parking in the back. Maxie's was recommended to me by a friend and it was a great suggestion! We had a great meal and the bartender was super friendly and efficient. I highly recommend Maxie's to anyone looking for a great meal in a great setting! Stopped by on our way back from Death Valley and had a great experience. Our server was very friendly, the beer was cold and the food was good. I've been here a couple of times and really like this place. I will definitely stop here again when I'm in the area.
text: Maxie's Bar and Grill is a family-owned and operated restaurant and bar in the heart of Las Vegas, Nevada, offering a wide variety of burgers, sandwiches, salads, desserts, and more.

original_text: My job was suppose to provide me a company car from the Las Vegas government agency. But they ran out of their vehicles. So without making any reservations from one of many rental car companies by McCarran Airport, I picked one and chose Dollar Rent a Car. The only compact car that was available was the Toyota Prius. The fuel-efficient vehicle is only a week old with less than 300 miles. I paid 59.00 a day. Might cost a lot, but at least I don't need to drain much on gas. Hey, I'm by myself in Vegas. You expect me to rent a Town Car or something nicer? Nevermind, don't answer!

original_text: The service is pretty darn good. The wine selection is always top notch.... but they lost me on the food! Understand, I have frequented this place since we moved into the area 5 years ago. I have also watched the food quality deteriorate over the past few years. It's not horrible, it's just not what it used to be. The most recent experience was horrible. I ordered the traditional spaghetti and meatballs... I was excited because it came with a side of garlic bread. When the food came, the meatballs were, literally, 12 the size of the first time I had them. The garlic bread was a piece of bread with a tiny amount of garlic butter. The spaghetti was slightly overcooked and the sauce was completely different than the previous times I had it. I am also an avid cheesesteak fan and the cheesesteak has been steadily declining over the past few years. I've eaten there, probably, 20 times and this was the worst experience I've had. That being said, the wine selection is excellent, the service is impeccable, and they have a great selection of cheeses and meats for takeout. Posted by soccermom on August 21, 2010 at 10:13 PM Re: "Kitchen Sink" Went here for lunch with two friends. I ordered the Kitchen Sink burger and added bacon. It was great. It's a big burger, so be prepared. The side I had, curly fries, were good, too. The service was great as well. We had a lively server who was very attentive. I liked the atmosphere of the place. It's a small, friendly place. I'll definitely be back. Posted by thefauxcatsmother on August 20, 2010 at 3:19 PM We go there at least once a week. They have a great brunch menu, but we usually get their lunch specials. They are filling, and very reasonably priced. They have great soups, salads, and wraps. This is one of the few places in town that serves a real Caesar salad. They have great desserts, too. Posted by AllergyAunt on August 19, 2010 at 2:57 PM I went here on a Saturday night, and was very impressed. The food was great, and the service was also excellent. I had the Greek salad, which was delicious, and one of the specials, which was a spinach cannelloni. I highly recommend this place. Posted by AriesLady on August 19, 2010 at 12:52 PM I have to say, I love this place! I have been here a few times, and have enjoyed it every time. The service is good, the food is great, and the prices are reasonable. We usually get the 12-price appetizers, and they are more than enough for two people. I have had the shrimp and grits (delicious), the crab cakes (yum), and a burger. The burger was so good that I would order it again. They have a great beer selection, too. Posted by AriesLady on August 19, 2010 at 10:34 AM I was really excited about this place when it first opened. I was even more excited when I had a wonderful meal there. The brisket was dry and stringy, and the fries were cold. I won't be going back anytime soon. I have been here a few times, and love this place! original_text: Now that their new inspection results have been published I understand why I get sick all the time. I'm going to avoid this place like the plague. They've been told to clean up their act a number of times over the last few years. I'm surprised they're still in business.
text: I've been a customer at this place for a number of years and it's always been a bit of a stinker - the food is always bad and the staff are always rude.

original_text: My family and I dined here in Nov and ordered an array of dishes. I forgot our waiter's name but he was a tall slender gentleman w. a beautiful smile. The service was outstanding and the food was just as amazing. I've never had such fresh, tender chicken. The gnocchi was absolutely phenomenal and the deserts were unbelievable. Our waiter was very helpful w. the selection of wine and made some great suggestions. I would highly recommend the restaurant and will be back. This was our first time visiting this restaurant and we had the most delightful dinner! The food was amazing and the service was so personal and professional. We will definitely be coming back!
text: This is one of the best restaurants I've ever had the pleasure of eating at. The food was amazing and the service was so personal and professional.

original_text: I came to Metro Pizza on the recommendation of a friend who lives in Las Vegas. This place is good. The service was fast and the prices were reasonable. My daughter and I split a Honolulu Pizza. My wife ordered Eggplant Parm. The food was served promptly, and even though we were seated in the back of the restaurant, we were not ignored. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be back.
text: I came to Metro Pizza on the recommendation of a friend who lives in Las Vegas. This place is good. The service was fast and the prices were reasonable. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be back.

original_text: Stations (casino chain) replaced the Metro Pizza at Boulder Station with (what I believe to be) their own pizza chain called Slices. We avoided it for quite awhile; we finally tried it last week. I was a little worried that it was going to be bad, but I was willing to give it a try. The pizza was a little on the salty side, but it wasn't bad. The crust was thin and crispy, but the sauce was a little runny and the cheese was a little greasy. Not the best pizza, but it wasn't terrible. We also got a large order of onion rings. They were pretty good, too. The onions were a nice size, the batter was light and crispy and the onion rings were cooked well. Overall, it was a decent meal. I don't know if I would go out of my way to eat there, but if I were at Boulder Station and wanted pizza, I would go back.
text: It's been a long time since I've had a pizza at Boulder Station, and I'm glad to report that it's finally back.

original_text: Stopped by Delmonico's for my birthday, per a recommendation from a friend.... and I would not hesitate to come again. I had the Bone-in Ribeye and it was by far the best steak I've ever head, juicy and tender, and everything you want in a steak. I ordered some sides but wasn't even necessary, I couldn't even finish the steak! Service was great. A little on the pricey side but worth spending the money at least once.

original_text: Two stars for outrageous price, 3 stars for quality of food. If you have had real and inexpensive Chinese food, it will be very hard for you to justify a 25 lunch for you and your wife, unless you have a lot of money to burn. I also think it is ridiculous to give a tip for a lunch, because if that is added to a bill, it will be over 30 of the total bill. If you are not willing to tip, you will feel as if you are being rude, and I do not think this is appropriate for any lunch. I am assuming that the owners of the restaurant want to make a lot of money, because they are doing a good job. But the food is not as good as it used to be, because they are no longer using MSG.
text: I have been to this Chinese restaurant a few times, and I have to say that the food is not as good as it used to be, and the price is ridiculous.

original_text: Wow. I have a love hate relationship with this place. I love it because my husband gets so happy here, I hate it because he spends so much money here. I love how much he gets for his money though. Its amazing. He was in the best mood yesterday after leaving here. He is amazed by the deals he keeps getting. Not only are the prices reasonable and discounted, they have groupons a lot. So for 30 dollars you get 70 to spend in the store. Its ridiculous. We have had like 10 groupons so far. Its crazy. He has gotten so many good deals. Check this place out. Or send you husband with a groupon, then ask him to get you something expensive. He will be so happy and riding off his shopping high, he will get you a coach purse or something nice. Just remember to look for a groupon though, it makes it even sweeter.

original_text: Amazing!!! We just moved here from California and looked on yelp for a place to take my 13 yr old son for a haircut. Other reviewers were spot on about this place being a clean, old school barbershop. My son loves this place and is already asking when he can go back. The staff is friendly and really know what they are doing. I even had the best cut I have ever had. We will be back.
text: The Barber Shop is a family-owned and operated barber shop offering a wide variety of haircuts and services to men and women in the greater Cincinnati area.

original_text: Well it didn't start off too good. We were not served for some time even though it did not seem busy. It was hot but there were a few tables full outside! Diane's Mojito was not very memorable because it had no mint taste, but the very helpful waitress did bring more. I had the Ahi tuna salad which was very good and Diane had the Beet salad which was also good except for the Salmon she had with it which was much too salty. Their IPA was very good and we shared a crime brulee which was delicious. The very friendly and helpful waitress even spoilt me with a fresh brewed coffee to go when I asked her to heat up the coffee she brought me originally. Overall a nice place and friendly staff and reasonably priced.

original_text: Everything is good! The roasted red pepper hummus is amazing! good place for a business lunch....patio seating during cooler weather is unbeatable..... Try the specials, they aren't the leftovers from yesterday! So glad that we found this place! Ate here twice during our recent trip to San Diego. The food was delicious! I'm not a picky eater, but I found so many good things on the menu. We had 2 breakfasts and one dinner here. The service was great. Get quick answers from Ki's Restaurant staff and past visitors.
text: Ki's is the best hummus place in San Diego..it's a great place to get a bite to eat in the summer..

original_text: They purposly make you wait in long line to make more purchases. I was picking up one chocolate and had to wait 15 minutes in line. They only have one cashier for non-members and it is not worth the wait. Founded in 1978, Trader Joe's is a chain of more than 325 grocery stores in the United States. The company operates stores in more than 30 U.S. states and employs approximately 35,000 associates. Trader Joe's offers a range of products, such as grocery, meat, seafood, frozen food, snacks, dairy, breads, beverages, prepared foods, sushi, beer and wine. Its grocery products include bananas, coffee, bagels, chips, salads and spices. The company s dairy products include butter, cheeses, eggs, ice creams and milk. Its seafood offerings include fishes, crabs, shrimps, salmons, trouts and tilapia. The company also operates online shopping services. Trader Joe's is a member of the Monrovia Chamber of Commerce.

original_text: Ok so I'll start by saying I used to work for JM at other locations (FL,NV). For the longest time I wouldn't go near another franchise (Subway, Quiznos, etc). Lately I've been working with a lot of quick service chains to help them with their social media and one of my goals is to help them create a better customer experience, so when it was time to try a few places to see how they're doing I decided to give Jimmy John's a try. I walked in and ordered a 6 combo with no sprouts. The person making the sandwich asked me if I wanted them on the side, I said "no sprouts." He asked again, so I said "sprouts are not on the sandwich." He said "I'm just making sure you want them on the side." I said "no" again, this time with more enthusiasm. I thought he was joking, but he wasn't. I walked away with my sandwich. I sat down at a table and took off the top piece of bread to take a look. Of course there were sprouts on the sandwich. I walked back up to the counter and the guy behind the counter said "what's up?." I said "I ordered this sandwich without sprouts and you put them on the sandwich." He said "are you sure?." I said "yes, I was there, I ordered it, I paid for it, I walked away with it." He said "I'm sorry, what can I do to make it right?" I said "I want a new sandwich with no sprouts on it." He said "you're gonna have to wait in line again." I said "no, I want you to go back and get it off the board and make me a new one with no sprouts." He said "okay, I'll be right back" and walked away. I waited and waited. At this point there was only one person in line. Eventually someone else showed up and asked "what's up?." The guy behind the counter said "just give him whatever he ordered." The new person said "yeah, I got it" and started making the sandwich. He came up to me and asked if I wanted sprouts on the side, I said "no." He said "I'm just making sure you want them on the side." I said "no sprouts" again, more enthusiastically. original_text: I wanted a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of the Strip. I thought the price was a little less than I would have went for, but I took it anyway. It is the Flamingo, right? WHAT A MISTAKE! I began having second thoughts when I walked through the casino to the elevators; the check-in was ok, though they wanted to charge me extra for being an hour early and sent me to get a rewards card to avoid the fee. The casino has a worn, depressing, smoked-out truck stop feel to it, like the Golden Nugget. OK, I told myself. But it is cheaper. I boarded the elevator with my friends, they were staying elsewhere and wanted to see the Flamingo for the first time. The elevators closed, revealing kick marks, scuffs, dirt and smears all over the interior. They opened to reveal carpet taped down with old duct tape. We walked past the old vending and ice machines, right in the hall, no room of their own. It gets better! As we entered my room, there was a nasty fake fur godawful throw laying across the bed, sticky stuff on the floor, mildew around the tub, blistered ceiling and cracks above the shower, and the closet door was hanging off its rollers. A look inside revealed that the entire door was peeling apart. The safe was useless- swipe any casino card from any casino (it asks you to swipe a credit card- yeah, right!!) and it will open. The lamps had not been dusted in at least months and the tables were dingy, as if wiped with a dirty rag. The floors are dark fake wood vinyl...depressing as the room itself. Nice towels- they were better than the Wynn's inexplicable sandpaper ones- but the damage was done. I was mortified and embarrased. I reported the problems to a Jennifer who could not have cared less. They didn't offer a refund- only an upgrade next time. Fool me once, shame on you- fool me twice, shame on me. To think for twenty bucks more a night I would have avoided all this at any other surrounding hotel. Lesson learned.
text: I wanted a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of the Strip. I thought the price was a little less than I would have went for, but I took it anyway. It is the Flamingo, right? WHAT A MISTAKE! I began having second thoughts when I walked through the casino to the elevators; the check-in was ok, though they wanted to charge me extra for being an hour early and sent me to get a rewards card to avoid the fee. The casino has a worn, depressing, smoked-out truck stop feel to it, like the Golden Nugget. OK, I told myself. But it is cheaper. original_text: BEST Creme Brulee in the world... well at least so far..that I have tried. It had banana and the bottom was lined with chocolate. Pure unadulterated heaven! Came here via Zomato. A cute little cafe with a great patio area. Went for breakfast. I had a boiled egg breakfast and it was very good. They have a good variety of food and drinks. Get quick answers from Cafe Greco staff and past visitors.
text: Cafe Greco is a family-run cafe and restaurant in the heart of the city, serving breakfast, lunch, dinner and weekend brunch, with a focus on local food and drink.

original_text: It's a small area, but big, beautiful sights to be seen. It changes so there is high replay value and between this and the Fountains you can spend a few hours doing something FREE and satisfying. For those into photography, this makes for great practice area. For those who just love taking family photos, this is a great photo op. I will say though that during the day it can get rather crowded so sometimes it'll be a wait before you can get your turn and have a clear shot, but most people are considerate enough to hold walking through if they see you are trying to capture a photo. You get a lot of nice natural sunlight through the glass ceiling, but if you don't mind night shots, it sometimes is very quiet depending on the setup. To me, the Chinese Year Year ones always look great at night whereas the spring one is best daytime. If you want to see all of the seasonal gardens, this is the schedule: 2013 Exhibit Calendar Chinese New Year Jan 12 - Mar 3 Spring Celebration Mar 9 - May 11 Summer Garden Party May 19 - Sep 8 Autumn Harvest Sep 14 - Nov 30 Winter Holiday Dec 6 - Jan 5, 2014 Between 5-6pm there are live musical performances from the Victorian Gazebo as well. If you're a flora nerd, apparently they do a QA with Mr. Ms. Green Thumb between 10:30am-11:30am. I would be interested to ask questions, but that is hella early for me! I'm always excited to see what they come up with. Sometimes animals and people are involved in the exhibit. My favorite was a rustic country springtime one with a a greenhouse full of butterflies. If you notice the gaps in the dates. I came once while they were transitioning and it was partially closed offunfinished areas. Tourist and locals come here and spend a day in Vegas finery without blowing a lot of cash! I come for the fountain show, the gardens and get a treat at Jean Philippe and realize half the day as gone by. (Yelp 100 Challenge 37100)

original_text: The service is pretty darn good. The wine selection is always top notch.... but they lost me on the food! Understand, I have frequented this place since we moved into the area a few years ago. I was a big fan of the handmade pasta and pesto. But is seems as if the focus on the food has slipped, and substantially at that. I'm giving three stars because of our server, Dave. He rocks. And the wine list, pretty much rocks. I haven't checked out the new wine bar, but it looks real nice. But, as for a meal. I'd be surprised if I go back... .... and I am tempted to take that down to two stars.... yeah.... I have to give it a meh.

original_text: RA sushi is so-so for sushi. It's not spectacular, but usually not terrible either. A group of us (7) came on a Saturday night and while we expected a wait for food and such because it was a weekend night, the service was much too slow. We had to remind our server to refill our drinks when they stood empty for 10 minutes because we didn't know where our server went. A few of us ordered the same alcoholic drinks, but they were prepared differently. I don't know what was going at the bar. The food must have taken 30-45 minutes to come out. Overall, a so-so experience.

original_text: STAY AWAY They are slum lords and could care less about the tenant. I had to wait about a week in 110 degree temps to get my AC fixed. It was out the whole summer. I moved into the complex in October of 2016. I am a clean person. I have been in my apartment for a little more than a month and I just received my first rent bill. My rent was paid on time. I was billed for a whole month rent and a fee for a new carpet. The old carpet is still in place. I was told by the manager that the carpet is new. The manager told me that he had a tenant that left my apartment that did not pay their rent or clean the apartment. The carpet was black. There was a cigarette butt on the wall when I moved in. The kitchen light is not working. I have had issues with lights going out in my apartment. The manager told me that he would fix them. They are still out. I am being billed for the carpet and a 1 month rent and the apartment is dirty. I have filed a complaint with the state and housing authority. I have been living at this complex for 3 months and all I have to say is "Don't move here"! The apartments are nice, but that's about it. The management team is HORRIBLE. The Manager, Naomi, is rude and unprofessional. She has a very bad attitude. She has lost rent checks and deposit money and refuses to send receipts. The maintenance crew is very nice and friendly, but they are not very professional. They have a hard time fixing things. The grounds crew is just as bad as the maintenance crew. They have let weeds grow to be taller than the grass and left a broken light post laying on the ground for more than a month. Don't let the grass and the pretty white fence fool you. This place is horrible!! This apartment complex is a nightmare. We have lived here for two years and have had nothing but problems. The apartments are nice, but the management is the worst I have ever dealt with. We were told when we moved in that the apartments were "brand new." This is not the case. We have had many, many maintenance issues and have never seen a manager. They do not return calls or respond to letters. Our parking lot is full of potholes and they have done nothing to repair it. We have had to take our car to the dealership because the parking lot is so bad. I am sure it is not even up to code. It is also very poorly lit. The complex is understaffed and they have no problem with this. The front office will leave early, without notifying anyone, and will not be back until Monday morning. We have been locked out of our mailboxes because they have forgotten to leave the key. The mailboxes are the only place we can get our mail. We have given notice to move and they will not respond to us. We have also tried to pay our rent and they have lost the check. We are moving out as soon as we can. I have been living here for a while and I have been having nothing but problems. There are so many maintenance issues. The management is always complaining about us going to the office. There is hardly any parking and the grounds are a mess. There is so much trash. We asked the office to put out some more trash bins and they did not. They also keep adding buildings to the complex. It is getting so crowded and the maintenance crew doesn't come when they say they will. It is horrible! I have been living at this complex for three years. We have been through two management companies. The first company was decent. The current one is horrible. We have had nothing but problems. We have had to fix many things ourselves. The office manager is rude and the maintenance is terrible. They have never replaced the ac unit. It has to be 8 years old and it is on its last leg. It is so bad that we have to have the window open because the air is so bad. I have talked to other people in the complex and they have had the same issues. We have been saving to move and will be out of here as soon as we can. It is the worst place I have ever lived! I moved in to these apartments a few months ago and so far it is okay. The apartments are a little small, but the rent is reasonable. The maintenance crew needs a lot of improvement. I have put in several work orders and they have not come out yet. We did have a plumbing problem in the bathroom and

original_text: I called around to locate and get price quotes for specific tires with an out the door price including mounting and balancing. Purcell quoted less expensive than the rest. I called back to order the tires. The clerk verified my tire size and verified the price quote from the day before. I arrived and told them I would like to wait for my tires to be completed. I was surprised to learn that I would have to pay the clerk 14 for the tire disposal fee. In addition to the out the door price I was quoted earlier. When I asked the clerk why I had to pay the disposal fee he said it was mandated by the State of California. I left the tire store and came back 45 minutes later. I asked the clerk for the balance of the tire disposal fee and he said it was 14. I asked him to verify that the disposal fee was mandated by the State of California and he said yes. I asked him for the reference number of the law that requires me to pay 14 for the tire disposal fee and he said the reference number was 54. When I asked him for the number of the specific law he said he didn't know. I asked him where I could find out the law that requires me to pay 14 for the tire disposal fee and he said I should ask the State of California. I called the CHP and asked them if the tire disposal fee was mandated by the State of California. They said the only fee they knew of was a 1.75 fee to cover the disposal fee. When I returned to the tire store the clerk told me the fee was actually 1.75 and he had to read the total due off of the register. I asked him to explain to me the difference between 14 and 1.75. He said the 14 was a fee that included mounting, balancing and disposal fee and the 1.75 was the disposal fee only. He said the tire disposal fee was mandated by the State of California. I asked him for the reference number of the law that requires me to pay the 1.75 tire disposal fee and he said it was 42940. original_text: The only reason we used to come here every week was for the food. Needless to say the got rid of the best menu items they had again. They used to have excellent stuffed peppers, now the stuffed peppers are made with very little cheese, peppers, and meat. It just looked like a pile of sauce on the plate. They used to have homemade meatballs, now the meatballs look like canned meatballs and taste like it too. They used to have some excellent sandwiches. Now they just have panini's which are very boring. I think the best item on the menu now is the pizza. The service is always good, but I'm not sure how much longer I can deal with the food being so bad. This place has become very boring and I'm not sure what they think they are doing. I know everyone loves Olive Garden, but I'll take this place any day over that. I also understand that they have a lot of the same items. It just seems like the have a lot less quality food now. This is the only restaurant in town that has great food! Their pizza is like the pizza in New York. The service is great. They have a really nice bar. The pizza is extremely fresh and delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone. After visiting here numerous times over the years, I have to say the service is always good. They always have really nice servers and they always do a good job of getting your food out in a timely manner. My only complaint is that I don't think they have any good items on the menu. I have ordered a variety of items and I have never been blown away by any of them. There just isn't much flavor in the food. I would say the pasta is probably the best thing on the menu, but it's not anything special. The salad bar is good. I'm not sure if I would recommend this place. The only reason I would come here is for the salad bar. It's pretty good. The salad bar is the only reason I come here. The pizza is extremely mediocre and the pasta is very bland. The food just isn't good here. I would recommend the salad bar, but not the rest of the food.
text: The food at Olive Garden has become so bad that I don't think I'll ever come back to this place again. This place has become very boring and I'm not sure what they think they are doing.

original_text: Overrated. I took my girlfriend here and now she is in the toilet puking.... ok not really but this place sucks. bad everything... wasted 65.: (Kid Kash July 27, 2010 at 9:19 PM Ive heard that this place has been overrated since it opened. Love this place. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I went here and was underwhelmed. I had the pork buns. They were good but I had better ones at other places. I also had the tuna tartare. It was the worst I've ever had. I think the "chef" used some sort of mayonnaisebalsamic sauce? I don't know, but it was gross. And I was underwhelmed by the atmosphere as well. It's just not a place I would want to go back to. On another note, I really like your blog! bad food, bad service. I was told the wait for the pork buns was 30 minutes and it took an hour and 20. Don't bother, I could think of a hundred other places to go in nyc. The food is AMAZING! If you think you can get pork buns any better you are crazy.

original_text: My husband and I wanted to try something new for date night and I've known about Bachi Burger for years through Yelp as one of the best burgers in Las Vegas as well as all of my friends constantly obsessing over it. We got here on a Friday night with a 25 minute wait which wasn't a big deal because we just walked over to Patty's closet to kill time. My in-laws said we have to try the salty caramel toasted marshmallow milkshake and we did. I'd say this was the best item of the night! It was a bit overly sweet, but still so addicting. We then ordered the oxtail chilli cheese fries as our appetizer to share. Upon first bite, I told my husband it was cold. I don't know if they made the fries and chilli and were just waiting for the fried egg to be put on top, but the food was definitely lukewarm by the time it was brought out to us and I like my food super hot, like it was made fresh. There wasn't much oxtail that I could taste and the warmth issue was very off putting. Lastly, we settled for the Miyagi San burger and Ronin burger. I LOVE fusion food, but I was not impressed by the flavors of the Ronin. Something was just missing to make it amazing. I did appreciate the crunch of the coleslaw and the caramelized onions, but all the other flavors cancelled out the taste of the fried egg. My husband's Miyagi burger was much better, but we asked for it medium and it was WELL done. There was no pink or anything, but the taste of the fried egg was amazing and the onion strips were crispy and fried to perfection. Overall, I would say that Holsteins has better burgers for this price range, and to not believe the DDD and Yelp hype. Come try it for yourself, but I don't think I'll be back.

original_text: Guys, WTF? Ate here because of the great reviews on yelp. Ended up throwing away basically all of our food. The meats were all chewy and grossly over-battered. It was like eating fried rubber. The fries were soggy. The tartar sauce was nasty. The clam chowder had a layer of mushy onions in the bottom. Everything was just gross. I'll never go back. This is a very good restaurant, with very good food and very good service. Excellent food and service. Their clam chowder is the best I've ever had.
text: This is the worst clam chowder I've ever had in my life. their clam chowder is the best I'll have ever had..

original_text: Great option if nothing is to your liking in Aria itself. Great for sports. I was here during march madness and it was off the hook. If you are into oysters the eastern are a bit better vs the western. They have multiple choices of meat in either 12 or full pound options served with your choice of 2 excellent unique sauces on the side with diff options on bread. I highly recommend the pickled vegetables if you are into that sort of thing. And they serve a beer after my own heart, the arrogant bastard. 'nuff said

original_text: Much hype for the chocolate man. Although I'm not a big chocolate person, I figured.... I was in Vegas! I'll give it a shot. Because I was unwilling to spend too much money for the food, I chose to get 2 small sliders. I don't remember what they were, but they were just generic sliders. Nothing spectacular. I tried the waffle smothered in chocolate and chocolate bits and ice cream. Syrup Desserts in DTLA is way, way better. All I tasted was chocolate, but no real flavor. The waffle was.... bland and lacking.

original_text: Oh Burritos....You plump little pockets of pleasure. You are pornography for the palette, fantastic and satisfying with a little guilt at the end. Unfortunately the burritos at Burrito's Juarez didn't live up to the hype. Burrito's Juarez is located at 216 5th Street in Astoria. It is a small store front with an eclectic collection of Mexican art and various paraphernalia. I ordered a chicken burrito with rice, beans and guacamole. The order was ready fairly quickly. When I took the first bite I had a moment of glee. This was going to be good. The chicken was tender and flavorful. The tortilla was light and the ingredients well proportioned. The guacamole was fresh. I was in heaven. And then the curse of the burrito hit. By the time I was halfway through my burrito it was a sloppy, messy, wet mass of food. The tortilla had been overwhelmed and was unable to sustain the pressure. The rice, beans and chicken all melded together into a flavorless, wet pile. My burrito was not only unappetizing, but also not good. Sadly, I just couldn't finish it. I will give Burrito's Juarez another try, but I'm not sure I'll order the chicken burrito again. Hours: 11am- 9pm Sunday through Thursday. 11am-10pm Friday and Saturday. Labels: Burrito, Burrito's Juarez, Clatsop County, Mexican

original_text: Blackened catfish grits, shrimp grits, crawpuppies - everything here is amazing, and Abita to boot! I've eaten my way through NOLA's best, oldest and most well-known eateries and Lola's has been my favorite stop. If you're in for the weekend, go to brunch here. If you're local, go here after the Saints game!

I've eaten my way through NOLA's best, oldest and most well-known eateries and Lola's has been my favorite stop. If you're in for the weekend, go to brunch here. If you're local, go here after the Saints game!

original_text: Lemme be clear. I don't own a gun. I'm not into shooting guns, or particularly even holding one. (My hands shake and I start feeling nauseous.) But I gotta say, after being in a few different gun shops for work...this place really takes the cake. I agree with Dave S. that Hyatt is a very highly respected shop. It's in fact one of the top 10 largest in volume gun dealers in the entire country. (One of the store employees even printed out the article to show me.) You'll see the vast selection of firearms on the walls, in the cases...and all the employees I talked to know their stuff inside and out. I was told the story behind machine guns, and the history behind certain handguns. The place is almost ALWAYS packed (even on Black Friday...when they don't offer any discountssales) and what I admire is how the salespeople take their time with each customer no matter how busy it is. The fact the customers all wait patiently and don't get mad...now that's loyalty.

original_text: Dear 4TWNT, We started off rocky a week ago with a porchetta sandwich that was a little light on the por and super heavy on the.... uh.... etta? More fat, less greens... especially when you're doing porchetta. And then we had to wait a really long time, especially for the meal we ordered. And then, over the course of the week, we have ordered pizza, chicken parm, and the grilled chicken salad and everything has been consistently good. And I will say the pizza is the best I've had in town. A little bit of sweet, a little bit of sauce, and the sausage is excellent. So, I'm going to give this place another shot. We've been back and have ordered the same things again. And I've had to make a couple special requests... (no lettuce on the salad, and make sure the chicken is cooked this time) and I'm happy to report that things have been good. I'll keep you posted as to how it goes. Our crew at 4TWNT can't wait to try this place out! Have you had a chance to visit? Let us know what you think!

original_text: Was stoked to see this little coffee shop while wandering PHX during a long layover. The menu boards in the back showed Aeropress, Hario V60, Clever, and Chemex at MKT. I don't see much Clever and Chemex in the US (at least on the west coast) so I was stoked to see them in use. I got the latte and they did an excellent job on that. It was simple and straightforward, but that's what I was in the mood for. The barista was very attentive and knew what he was doing. After I finished the latte, I sat down and enjoyed a pour over while browsing the web on my phone. They had a small library of magazines to look at, and one of them was a great new one called Arcade . The coffee was great. I loved the pour over, and this place is a gem. I wish I could have stuck around for the rest of the day, but I had a flight to catch.

original_text: My friend and I stopped here for a light dinner before going to a movie at the AMC theater in the same plaza. Not sure why we picked this place. I think we just both realized we were kinda hungry after we'd already parked and walked in. Mi Amigo's was never really on my radar as a place to try. I'm more a fan of the hole-in-the-wall real mexican food place. This place kinda felt like a mexican-themed, or mexican-inspired restaurant but it lacked something.... almost felt like a food court with table service. The food was fine. It wasn't bad. The service was fine. My friend had the shrimp and garlic platter, and enjoyed it. I had a small tortilla soup. We probably over-did it with the chips and salsa. And even those were just fine. I would have liked for someone to just leave a pitcher of water (no ice) on the table because it felt like an eternity between refills and each refill succeeded in mostly adding more ice to my glass. No bueno. No dessert, no drinks. Wasn't really feelin' it. I wouldn't say I'm jumping at the chance to eat here again. It's serviceable. If I find myself at the AZ Center and other people want to eat here, I will do my best to make suggestions to go elsewhere, but I won't encourage it. But I won't fight it if the majority rules.

original_text: I would give Ginza 0 stars if I could! This was truly the worst dining experience I have ever had. My husband took me to Ginza for my birthday. Upon entering, the restaurant stunk, like dirty wet dog. They sat us in one of the little private rooms, where you have to take your shoes off and climb in to this Japanese style table. I could literally feel dirt, dropped food etc on the floor. The paint and wallpaper were peeling off. It was shocking how run down it was. Our waiter took about 15 minutes to finally appear. He was sweating and obviously frantic. He took our drink orders and took another 15 minutes to return. We placed our orders, and waited. While we waited, 2 servers attempted to bring us food that was not ours. Everyone seemed to be confused and rushed. My husbands food arrived..... And we waited some more. He ordered the hibachi. I ordered sushi. My food was MIA. My husband was completely finished by the time my food arrived. The sushi was not fresh. Some of it I couldn't even eat. We decided to skip dessert and just get out of there. When the server finally brought our bill, it was hand written and very confusing. I asked the server to explain all the charges. I pointed out that we were charged for my husbands salad, which was included on the meal. The server went and changed it. I asked what the charge was at the bottom, and he said it was our drinks. But they were included above. I finally asked to see the manager, and he explained that extra charge was an 18 gratuity already included because we were sitting in the little private room. What? Are you serious? We complained about the service and food, and the botched bill, and the manager gave us the meal for free. While I appreciated the effort to make it better, We will never return. Don't ever go there! That place should be shut down!

They offer a great variety of food, including different types of hot dogs, burgers, sandwiches, salads and poutines. There was a vegan and vegetarian menu available for those with dietary restrictions as well. The food was delicious! I came with a big group so I got to try different things. The service was fast and friendly and the restaurant itself is very modern. They are located in the heart of downtown and it is great place to stop by if you are in the area. I would definitely recommend it to everyone and I can't wait to go back!
