original_text: Love this place, eat here a least once a week. Have brought many of our friends and neighbors, they also love Las Cazuelas, food is great, the margaritas are fabulous and the staff is the best!! A local favorite, Las Cazuelas has been serving up some of the best Mexican food in the area for more than 20 years. The food is delicious, freshly prepared, and a great value. My favorite is the Chicken Enchiladas with Salsa Verde (one of the best in town). The Tamales are also amazing. The servers are friendly and efficient and the margaritas are strong. I'm very disappointed in the service and food quality. We went for lunch, sat down and waited 30 minutes to be served. I ordered a beef enchilada and a side of beans and rice. The beans and rice were cold. The enchilada was so-so. I went to the restroom and when I got back the table was clear. No dessert. We were never offered dessert. It was really strange. We ate there a couple of weeks ago and it was very good. We enjoyed the food and had a great time. We went back tonight and the service and food was terrible. There were only 3 other tables occupied and we had to wait 20 minutes for our meal. We are going to give Las Cazuelas another chance next time we go out for Mexican food. I love this place. I have eaten here several times and I have had a variety of items. Everything I have had has been good. I have recommended this place to others and they love it too. The service is great, the margaritas are great, and the food is great! We have gone to Las Cazuelas several times. The food is good and the price is right. They have great margaritas. The portions are huge. I have never had a bad meal there. Las Cazuelas is a gem in a sea of so so Mexican restaurants. The food is fresh, and the portions are generous. They have a great variety of options and all at a reasonable price. They have excellent margaritas and a great atmosphere. This is a great place to eat.

original_text: Well, once in a lifetime is enough for this I think. I have been there multiple times when friends and family come to visit and am disappointed each time. If you are in a hotel you could head there to grab a drink but you have to pay the 15 to get in. Not worth it in my opinion. While we were at the Grand Canyon we stayed at the El Tovar, which was first class. We ate in the hotel restaurant and the food was very good. They do have a little store, which has some great things. The main dining room is a very nice place and the views are wonderful. They have a very nice breakfast buffet and the waiterswaitresses are very professional. I would eat there again when I return to the Grand Canyon. There is a nice little store right in the hotel, with a great selection of things to buy. The Grand Canyon National Park has a very nice gift shop also. We did some serious shopping there. You can get some very nice souvenirs. The El Tovar is a very nice hotel, right in the middle of the Grand Canyon National Park. They have some very nice rooms. The front lobby is a great place to hang out in the evening. The food is good in the restaurant and the views are terrific. We were there in May and the weather was perfect. I am not sure how it would be in the heat of summer but in May it was perfect.
text: Well, once in a lifetime is enough for this I think. I have been there multiple times when friends and family come to visit and am disappointed each time. If you are in a hotel you could head there to grab a drink but you have to pay the 15 to get in. Not worth it in my opinion. While we were at the Grand Canyon we stayed at the El Tovar, which was first class. We ate in the hotel restaurant and the food was very good. They do have a little store, which has some great things. The main dining room is a very nice place and the views are wonderful. They have a very nice breakfast buffet and the waiterswaitresses are very professional. I would eat there again when I return to the Grand Canyon. There is a nice little store right in the hotel, with a great selection of things to buy. The Grand Canyon National Park has a very nice gift shop also. We did some serious shopping there. You can get some very nice souvenirs. The El Tovar is a very nice hotel, right in the middle of the Grand Canyon National Park. They have some very nice rooms. The front lobby is a great place to hang out in the evening. The food is good in the restaurant and the views are terrific. We were there in May and the weather was perfect. I am not sure how it would be in the heat of summer but in May it was perfect.

original_text: We stayed here for two nights in July. Here's the break down: The good: 1) Super helpful staff, every person we came in contact with was fantastic. 2) Awesome in room hot tub 3) A fully appointed kitchen in our suite. The ability to eat in is actually very nice. 4) The layout of the Suite. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, we liked the separation of the living area and sleeping area. 5) Convenient distance to monorail station The bad: 1) The hike from self-parking to the the hotel, hauling luggage downstairs in 106 degree weather, no bueno. 2) the lay out of the actual hotel. Only saw two exitentrances both dead center of the hotel. It made for a lot more walking when staying in the wings. We did love our stay, we were very happy with our room and the experience in general. We planned the trip to be a no driving vacation, which it was. We parked the car when we got there and walked or took public transport everywhere we went. Had we been using the valet service, we probably wouldn't have noticed.

original_text: We arrived at the restaurant during early evening on a Thursday. There were only two other customers at the time sitting at a corner table. The female at that table was dressed in a similar style to the "hostess." I'm assuming she was the owner, and the hostess. The hostess brought us to a table right by the front window. We were able to see the parking lot from our seats. We had a good view of the cars pulling in and the customers walking in. I had a hard time choosing an appetizer. I knew I wanted something a bit lighter, and didn't want a salad. The hostess described the rolls as "crispy," so I decided to get a few to start. The rolls were served with a thin, tasty, sweet, dark brown sauce. The sauce was very good. The rolls themselves were not as crispy as I expected, but they were still good. For my entree I ordered the spicy chicken wings. The wings came with a side of white rice. I ordered a Thai iced tea to drink. The wings were very good, crispy and juicy. The sauce was a bit spicy. I could not find the menu online, but I think I remembered it being spicy 3. I'm not a spicy food eater, but it was tolerable. The wings were not as spicy as the entree I ordered a few weeks ago at Thai Noodle Cafe. My husband ordered the chicken curry. He also ordered a Thai iced tea. I liked the green tea flavor of the iced tea. I tried a bit of my husband's curry, but I'm not a fan of curry. My husband really liked the curry, and said it was better than the one he ordered the last time we went. After we finished our meals, the hostess brought over the check, and a fortune cookie. The fortune cookies were filled with the same fortune as my last visit to Thai Delight. I assume that the fortune cookies are left over from a New Years Eve dinner or something. I thought it was kind of odd, but it was still fun to read. I'm keeping the fortune for good luck. During our meal, more customers arrived. The hostessowner was very friendly. There were a few more tables near the back of the restaurant. I didn't notice the bathroom, but I'm sure there was one. I'm assuming that the restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. The restaurant is small, but I think they have the capacity to seat around 20 people. My husband and I had a good meal at Thai Delight. The service was friendly and fast. I think the prices are reasonable. I would go back again in the future. I think Thai Delight would be a good choice for a casual lunch or dinner. I'm looking forward to trying some of their other menu items. I'm glad you had a good experience at Thai Delight. The owner is very friendly, and they do serve good food. I think I'll have to try those crispy rolls sometime. Thanks for the review. I don't remember seeing the fortune cookies there last time. Hmmm. I think I'm a little overdue for a visit. I was really hungry by the time I arrived, and I didn't remember seeing the fortune cookies either. But I was so hungry that I probably would have eaten them if I was handed one. My friend and I ate there last night. I had the chicken curry and she had the pineapple fried rice. We both liked our entrees, but the pineapple fried rice was really good. She and I both liked the Thai iced tea. I think we would go back there again for dinner.
text: My friend and I recently went to a Thai restaurant in the Villages, and we both had a good time. The rolls themselves were not as crispy as I expected, but they were still good.

original_text: As a previous rater acknowledged, this is the only Club Car dealer in the area. This is unfortunate. Several things bugged me about this place. They overprice their new carts, then heavily discount them (kinda like cheap used car dealers of old.) But the real issue for me was the service department and dealership management. They did not listen and therefore prescribed the wrong fix at inflated pricing. When I asked questions in an attempt to get them to better understand the issue, I was told, maybe you should just fix it yourself. In addition the service department was very dirty and seemed disorganized. The experience led me to leave their facility, do some research, and actually fix it myself. Their quote was 2000, my cost ended up at 750. The combination of incompetence and arrogance at this place must come from their near monopoly in Phoenix for Club Car. I would push my car off a cliff and buy an EZGO before I would ever do business with them.

original_text: I wanted to like this place. It's close to my house, decent prices, really friendly, and they do a nice job. But, it doesn't seem to matter whether you make an appointment or not. They are always under staffed, even despite the fact that they are never that busy. I gave them several chances but after having to wait 30 or more minutes even though having an appointment 3 times, then actually attempting to send me to their Indian School location (I had an appointment at the McDonald location) I decided it wasn't worth it. I won't be returning.

original_text: Whoever said the portions here are small must eat some serious food! Yes, the portion sizes are small, but c'mon, it's an all-you-can-eat buffet! Have 10 rounds if you're that hungry. We ordered the 'Eat All You Can' for RM13.90 each. And I didn't stop at 10 rounds. I had 12! Yup, I'm a piggy and I'm not afraid to admit it. I know it's unhealthy to eat so much, but I just couldn't stop! We ordered a bucket of 10 pieces of dumplings for RM11. The dumplings were sooooo good. The skin was so thin and the fillings were juicy. We tried the chicken, beef and seafood dumplings. I liked the chicken dumplings best. The beef dumplings were a little too spicy for my liking. My second favourite would have to be the seafood dumplings. It was so yummy with the prawns and fish filling. There were 2 types of soup: the tasty yee-mee soup and the tomato soup. We ordered the yee-mee soup. The yee-mee soup was very tasty and spicy. But I did find it a little too salty. The soups are served in hot pots. I loved the dim sum here. I had at least 5 of these. I liked the chicken ones better. The ones with the mushrooms were yummy too. We ordered the sweet and sour pork. I felt that the sweet and sour pork was a little too oily. It was also a little too sweet. We ordered the chicken noodles. I loved the chicken noodles here. The noodles were springy and tasty. The chicken chop was yummy too. I loved the fried rice here. It was so yummy with the thick gravy. The fried rice was really yummy. I had 4 rounds of this. We ordered the pork chop too. The pork chop was okay. Nothing great. This was a little too salty for my liking. I'm not a fan of the sotong. We ordered the pumpkin chicken. The pumpkin chicken was yummy. I liked the sweet flavour. My favourite part of the meal was the dessert. I had at least 6 rounds of the dessert. The desserts were so yummy. I loved the green-tea jelly the best. We also tried the fruit salad. I loved the vanilla ice-cream here. I had to stop myself after 12 rounds of food. I'm not even exaggerating. I really ate that much! I had so much fun. I would definitely come back here again for another round of food. So, if you're a fan of all-you-can-eat buffets, you should definitely come here. I'm going to bed. Time for me to sleep. yeah..they've got good food but dun think i'm going back there to eat.. coz i find it very uncomfortable to eat there.. u know.. the place is so small n u've got to wait for a long time for the food to arrive n the food itself not very big.. n the lady there.. not very friendly.. And yes, it was soooo yummy. I had at least 6 rounds of it. I went there for dinner today and its closed down.. no more pork chop chicken rice buffet.. I was so sad!

original_text: You'd think, wouldn't you, that with a name like Hillside Spot this restaurant in Ahwatukee would be nestled in a pastoral setting with lovely views? Not so, it's in a strip mall next to a movie theater. The food, though, is quite good. It's a breakfast, lunch and dinner joint, and their breakfasts are outstanding. The pancakes are particularly notable, and the huevos rancheros, though not overly spicy, are very tasty. The service is friendly and efficient, and the wait staff is well-versed in the menu. It's a great place for a family breakfast, and a business breakfast, and you can get take-out breakfast burritos and sandwiches. The dinner menu includes sandwiches and burgers, steak, seafood, pork, and chicken. The blackened chicken Caesar salad is a winner. 6223 S. 32nd St., Phoenix, AZ 85042 Monday-Friday 6:30 a.m. - 3 p.m. Saturday Sunday 7 a.m. - 3 p.m. Map to Hillside Spot
text: If you're looking for a good breakfast, lunch, or dinner place in the Phoenix area, Hillside Spot is a good place to start.

original_text: I am mad that ha had to give this place even 1 star. See the old reviews were pretty good then the newer reviews are mostly bad. This place changed ownership in 2015 and so far they are not doing a good job. I tried to get a table for 6 (yes I had a reservation) and they told me that they had to wait to get a table for 14 (no reservation) first. That's right they would rather have 14 people and their whole families (small children included) wait to get seated then my party. I ended up eating at Olive Garden. The manager said he would call me back and he never did. It's just bad business to treat customers this way. I guess you don't have to treat people with respect if you can get away with it. They'll never see me again. Ate here the other night with a friend. The food was great and the service was good. The atmosphere was a bit loud, but I think that was mostly because the restaurant was crowded. I would definitely eat here again. We tried the last three dishes that are not on the menu, but are on the website. The salads were just ok, but we were happy that they had gluten free options. The homemade chips were actually pretty good. We'll be back to try more items on the menu. I really wanted to like this place. I don't like leaving bad reviews, but I just can't recommend this place. There were so many things that were just not right. My husband ordered a pasta dish that was covered in sauce that was so sweet it tasted like it was made with ketchup. I ordered a sandwich that was dried out, not even warm. The menu looks nice, but I think they need to work out the kinks. I'll give them one more try, but I'm not expecting much. I really like this place. It's my go to place for coffee. They have a lot of choices for coffee and the staff are friendly and knowledgeable. I highly recommend it. I don't usually care for chain restaurants, but we were out of town and needed a quick meal. We both enjoyed our salads and the service was very good. It's a good place to eat when you're on the go. This place is fantastic! The food is always excellent. The owners are very friendly and service is excellent. We've been coming here for years. It's a great place for lunch or dinner.

original_text: My boyfriend and I went with another couple and went through all three haunted houses. The Circus Clown themed house was fun and the perfect amount of scary to ease you into it. The Vampyre Castle was really well done (I love Vampires) and was more intense than the Circus Clown house. Now for the main attraction: The Gates of Hell.... I was already announcing to the group that I don't want to go through this house, I'm good with the other two. Of course I was convinced into going and everything would be fine. I won't give away any of the haunts inside but I will say I had to say the safe word because I couldn't take it anymore. I've read all of these negative comments and it seems like I had the same experience as the others but I was expecting it. It is made extremely clear prior to you entering the house that you will be abused psychologically, physically, and not everyone can handle it. Even being the only one out of my group who caved and opted out I still think that this Trilogy is awesome! They do their jobs very well. Not everyone can handle the R rated house (me being one of them) but I expected everything that happened to happen. All in all, if you are up for the scare of your life then go!!! Yes they touch you but eventually they have to stop.... It's a great time!

original_text: My friends recommended this place since they only live down the street and how can you beat all you can eat Korean BBQ for 20 bucks!! What a steal! Came on a Friday night for dinner and we didn't even have to wait for a table. The place was empty. They started us off with a cup of soup each and some salad. Then the servers brought over the grill and you could pick from beef, pork, and chicken. I went with the traditional pork and beef combo. The meat was really tender and had just the right amount of marinade. The only thing is that the meat was placed in a small box and they would take it away if you didn't finish it all. I had to take some home. They also had a bunch of side dishes that you could add to your meal such as kimchi, mushrooms, bean sprouts, tofu, and of course, rice. The side dishes were pretty good, but nothing to write home about. The best part of the meal was the dessert, fried bananas. The dessert was a nice sweet ending to a perfect meal. I would definitely return here to get my Korean BBQ fix.
text: I've been wanting to try Korean BBQ for a long time, but never got around to it until I found this place in the middle of nowhere.

original_text: We've been here plenty of times before and it seems like its always crowded no matter what time or day. The food is good and what I especially like is the fact that they have many things on the menu to choose from. You will find a variety of Asian cuisine. Most of their dishes are delicious and I like that you get plenty of food for the price. For a family of 4 you might spend 40.00 to 50.00 for dinner. Their menu is a lot to read so if you want to do some advance planning of what you're going to order you can visit their website. They do have a large dining area and the waitresses are very friendly and helpful. I love their sweet and sour chicken, orange chicken, egg rolls, General Tso's Chicken and fried rice. My family always gets their dinner combos which includes fried rice and they love the shrimp and scallops. The one thing that they could improve on is the size of the restaurant. It gets very crowded in there. It can be loud and hard to find a place to sit. Sometimes we will stop in here after a movie and we've never had a problem getting a table. If you're in the mood for Chinese food and are in the area I highly recommend stopping in for a bite to eat. They have plenty of seating and the food is great. They are open every day from 11:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. The Hibachi Grill and Supreme Buffet is located at 2401 S. Military Hwy in the Freemason area of Norfolk, VA. You can contact them at .

original_text: The service was very friendly and they get most of their stars for that. The menu was fairly limited compared to some of the other phoVietnamese food restaurants. The check in offer was a free order of egg rolls. Since we came early in the AM, he had to check if they had any prepared yet. Turns out they did, and they were fresh and delicious. But, unfortunately I am pretty sure they ended up charging us for it. The pho was bland and extremely forgettable. I really fail to see where these high ratings are stemming from. They skimped on everything AND the broth tasted like hot water until I added sriracha, then it tasted like sriracha water. The bathroom looked like it doubled as a broom closet. I don't have any reason to go back or recommend this place to friends.

original_text: This place needs more credit than what it's been given. They have amazing sides and plenty to choose from, the meat was tender, juicy and full of flavor, and service was great. Not to mention the sauce is in a heated dispenser- win! The man working behind the counter who helped us said he was from Georgia.... Georgia people! He's gotta know what he's doing lol Rudy's and their paper-lined baskets and weird sides.... meh! Come here for a real BBQ meal.

original_text: Flying with any airline can be painful, as many reviews indicate. Over the last ten years of nearly weekly travel I have come to know many of the Phoenix employee's of UnitedTed at Terminal 2. I have to say that all of them are great! Everyone here is challenged with many bad things every day, weather, delays, mechnical problems, air traffic control, and worst of all - egotistical travellers. I have seen so many rude travellers over the years, my mind reels at how these guys can keep their sanity. With very few exceptions there are just a ton of superstars at United in Phoenix. The Red Carpet club is staffed by many of my United favorites and they are always kind and helpful as well. At least at Terminal 2 you can at least find an employee and get help compared to many airports across the country. Travel sucks, but United sucks less than the others!

original_text: The atmosphere and ambiance of 1947 was quite good and there is no question that they have an outstanding selection of bourbon. I was also greeted very quickly and cordially by the bartender and was seated quickly. I am a bourbon enthusiast and the bartender was kind enough to give me a quick tour of the available bourbons, but I felt he was a bit rushed and somewhat insincere. He suggested that I might like a bourbon and water with a simple syrup for a mere 18. I was shocked that he was suggesting a 18 cocktail, so I ordered a different cocktail. The cocktail was excellent, but very small. My wife had a beer and we split an appetizer, which we enjoyed. We were somewhat surprised to see our bill for 55. We have eaten at many other restaurants in the area and the food and drink was not as good as other places for the same price. There is no question that the bourbon selection is excellent and the food is good, but there are plenty of other options in the area that are as good or better for the same price.
text: My wife and I recently went to 1947 for dinner. There is no question that the bourbon selection is excellent and the food is good, but there are plenty of other options in the area that are as good or better for the same price.

original_text: Walked in here looking for a cute skirt for my birthday dinner. First thing that caught my attention was the really weird smell. It was like foul cleaner and BO. Totally gross. Sucked it up and looked around since they had some cute clothes. Nothing is really in any kind of order, so I literally circled the store 3 times and found skirts in different places each time. Kind of bothersome to me. I never spoke to anyone and none of the employees spoke to me. I wasn't in the mood to chitchat, but it didn't look like they approached ANY customers. So heads up for those who don't like to ask for help. Quality of fabric isn't spectacular on most garments, and seems like it wouldn't last too many washings - unless you hand-washed it perhaps. The dresses are pretty cute, though, and I may come back to try some on for a wedding in the future. On second thought.... I don't want my clothes to smell like the store. Scratch that. Um.... Good lighting?

original_text: Wife an I was there last night, the band was playing they were so so, but the people that were there were dancing and having fun...So we thought this looked like a good place to stop an get a bite to eat. So I had the 2 pc. chicken dinner which came with mashed potatoes an gravy, corn an rolls. The chicken was some what greasy but the mashed potatoes an corn was good. The wife had the 2 pc. catfish dinner, she said the fish was greasy an didn't taste good. Well the waitress ask if we wanted to order another drink, the wife told her we had a bottle of water, an she said to us we didn't order that. We told her no we didn't, but we were drinking it, she said we couldn't do that. So we ask her to take it off the bill an she said no, she said we ordered it. We told her no we didn't, the wife ask for the manager. So she said, well go to the bar an ask for him. So I said if you can't take it off the bill an you don't have a manager, I'll go to the bar an pay for it myself. So I walked to the bar an paid for it. I was so mad that I had to leave my dinner, I wanted to walk up to the stage an ask the band to stop playing, because I couldn't see straight anymore. I told the wife to forget the dinner, we needed to get out of there. So if you like to have a good time an listen to a good band, this is the place. But don't eat the food. We were looking for a place to eat on a Sunday night. The server was very friendly and the food was delicious! We ordered the prime rib dinner and the seafood platter. Everything was fresh and the salads were huge! We had a 24 hour layover in Santa Maria and were looking for a place to have a quick bite to eat. We came across the Nipomo Inn, which had good reviews and looked to be a fun place. The bartender greeted us right away and we ordered a round of drinks and appetizers. My husband ordered the salsa, which was very tasty. My appetizer was the nachos, which were very good, served with fresh guacamole. We then ordered the chicken Caesar salads and they were also excellent. The portions were large and fresh. I would definitely recommend this place and the service was great. I stopped in for some lunch with friends, this place is very busy and full of locals, great place to go and enjoy a meal, the waiter was very nice and the food was excellent. I had a burger and fries and my friend had the chicken, I have to say the chicken was so good I will be going back for that next time, and my burger was great as well, I would def recommend this place for lunch or dinner. So we stopped in here to grab some lunch on our way out of town. We got there around 11:30 and were greeted by a very nice lady. The place had a casual, laid back vibe to it. It was fairly busy at this time of day but they still managed to serve us our food in a timely manner. My husband got the chicken fried steak (which he enjoyed) and I got the roast beef dip (which I loved!). It was a nice, hearty meal for a reasonable price. I'd definitely come back again. I know some people find the decor dated and I can see why. But it's fun, like stepping back in time. The food is fresh and the atmosphere is laid back. We had a nice time there. On a long road trip, my husband and I were looking for a place to eat. We saw the Nipomo Inn and figured it might be a good place to eat, and it was. The food was great, the service was nice, and they had good prices. I highly recommend this place. Be the first to add a review to the Nipomo Inn.

original_text: One of the few Cirque du Soleil that follow a story line, so if you are looking for a Cirque du Soleil show and a story this is the one to see. Although it strays a bit from the traditional style of Cirque du Soleil, it is still sure to please. We were fortunate enough to be able to purchase front section tickets for 50 off AMAZING deal! (End of summer special). KA is the show which it is the stage that is at the center of attention. It uses a sectional stage that is fully mobile it rotates and moves on a 3D axis it really adds another level of excitement to the show. I would not recommend this as anyone's first Cirque du Soleil show but for a any repeat or veteran Cirque du Soleil viewer this must make it onto your Seen it list.

original_text: So extremely disappointed. My mother booked two nights at the Stratosphere for a much needed couples week-end with my husband. She used Expedia. Cus we Expedia the Stratosphere kept telling us we booked with a third party and to work details out with them. Expedia said to call hotel and request room type and preferences. When I did I was told hotel did not have our reservation from Expedia yet and call back day before. When I called a day before I was told rudely we were in the old un remodeled part of the tower in two queen bed and it was to late to make changes. Once we got there we did get one queen bed but very far from the pool and with a horrible view of the rooftop of another building and depressing North Las Vegas. We ate diner at Mac gross -the most pathetic attempt at a steak house. Gross. The pool closes at 7. There is only ONE POOL and it's full of kids in clothes. Sunday we slept in. Skipped brunch an decided to have dinner in the tower at 11:00pm. Everything was closed (with exception of the diner) club 107 had only 4 appetizers available out of the entire menu. None appetizing. By the way.... We had to pay 15 per person per day to. Use the facilities as a guest of the hotel! WTF?! That was 90 extra for a gross kid filled jacuzzi and a pool that closed at 7! A restaurant that closed too early to enjoy and a stinky old room with a debtor easing view. No wonder 7 people have committed suicide here! We should have stayed in Laughlin!

The Copper Star Coffee is located on the southwest corner of Scottsdale Road and Shea Boulevard.

original_text: Worst pedicure ever! Went in there for the first time yesterday afternoon. They were busy but still had plenty of chairs open for pedicures. My friend and I got seated right away and everything seemed great. Then the nail tech handed me the card to pick out which pedicure I wanted. The regular is 19 and includes nail trimming, brief massage, basic nail color. The only other option was a 40 one with callus remover, scrub and paraffin wax. Kind of ridiculous that they only have two options with such big price differences. All other nail places I've been to at least include hot stone and a decent massage in their basic pedicure. I chose the regular with no extras. The nail tech seemed annoyed by that and totally rushed through everything. The lotion massage was pretty much just her slapping some lotion on my legs. We were out of there in about a half hour, which is the shortest time I've ever been in a nail salon for a pedicure. The nail tech did not thank us for our business and did not ask to see us again... so I will never go back again!

original_text: This mall has been since as long as I've lived here in Vegas. It's been through some changes over the years, but it remains clean, up to date, safe and fun. There are plenty of stores to choose from, food court and restaurants to eat at. I've enjoyed going to this mall with my family and friends for the past few years. It's a great place to shop, eat and catch up. We went to the Luxor last week, and we didn't have the greatest time. I'm not sure if it was because we were visiting during the day, but it just seemed like the energy wasn't there. We walked through the casino and I didn't see a lot of people sitting down and enjoying themselves. There was a show that we wanted to see, but we didn't get a chance to, but hopefully we can go back and do that. I did enjoy the outdoor area that was in the middle of the hotel. I love going here to get my hair done. The stylist have always been really nice and welcoming. They work with me to get me the right style and color that I want. I've had a few bad experiences at other places, but this one I've been going to since I was a little girl. I love the vibe here and always leave feeling happy. The original store in Henderson is actually where my parents went to get their first wedding cake. It was 33 years ago and they still remember how delicious it was. Now, we go here for birthdays or other special occasions. The cake is always good and so are the other desserts. It's a fun place to go to celebrate. I've been to this store a couple of times and they always have the best sales! I've been able to find some really nice and stylish clothes at great prices. The atmosphere is always so friendly and welcoming. The store isn't too big, but it has a lot to choose from. I love that there are stores like this in Vegas. I love going here to shop. I'm not a huge fan of the mall, but this store is always one that I like to stop in. They have really good prices for the items that they sell. I've found great deals on clothes, shoes and other accessories. The workers are always helpful and courteous. My family and I love going to the movies. We usually go on the weekends to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It's not too far away from where we live, and the theater is very nice. The seats are comfortable and there's always plenty of movies to choose from. We have never had a problem with the workers. They're always very courteous and helpful.

original_text: My first ever visit to the almighty XS to see what the fuss is all about would have been a much more enjoyable experience had it not been for the continuous string of DJs playing the same 10 songs over and over. I didn't arrive to the club until around 2:30 a.m., but it was already in full swing. Despite being a Wednesday night, XS was packed to the rafters with people trying to forget that they had work the next day. I arrived just in time to catch Kaskade, who was finishing his set. He looked like he was having a great time, and the crowd was really into it. The set ended with the DJ bringing out his friend and putting her on stage to sing. After that, Alesso took over for the next hour. He played a few popular songs, including his remix of "If I Lose Myself" by OneRepublic and his "Let Me Feel" remix. He also played some of his own work, which I recognized from his album, "Swedish House Mafia Friends," which is a compilation of some of the best DJs, including Alesso. Next up was Zedd. He started off with a remix of his song "Clarity," which the crowd loved, and ended with a remix of "Spectrum" by Zedd and Matthew Koma, which also brought the house down. After Zedd, the music was turned down and lights went up. DJing stopped for a bit, and the crowd was in complete shock. I didn't understand at first, but then I realized that this was the best part of the night. A sexy burlesque dancer came out and performed for the next 10 minutes. The performance was amazing. The woman was fit, and her outfits were very provocative. She wore a very small top with a skirt, fishnet tights and tall heels. After the burlesque dancer was finished, the DJs returned, but it was too late for me. I could only tolerate so many remixes of the same songs. The next day, I realized that I didn't even catch the headlining act. I've never heard of him, so I can't say how big of a deal he is. But my friends that went to XS that night said that he was pretty good. They said that he played some new songs that weren't even out yet, and he sounded pretty good. However, it was way too crowded at XS. I can't even imagine how difficult it must be to fight through the crowd just to get to the bar or the bathroom. For now, I'll just stick to the more low-key clubs in Las Vegas. Tagged as Alesso, burlesque, burlesque dancers, dancers, entertainment, Kaskade, Las Vegas, Las Vegas Backstage Access, Las Vegas clubs, Las Vegas entertainment, Las Vegas music, Las Vegas nightclubs, Matthew Koma, Music, nightclubs, Swedish House Mafia, XS, XS Las Vegas, Zedd
text: DJs Kaskade, Alesso and Zedd were among the big names who played at the XS nightclub in Las Vegas on Wednesday night, as part of the club's new residency.

original_text: Came here for my birthday which was on a Wednesday in March. The weather was beautiful and breezy. There were some people but there were many open tables so we had no trouble finding a spot to set up our gear. Not very crowded but there were some kids and dogs here and there. The beach itself is very pretty but it is a very rocky beach with some areas you can walk in the water, other areas you cannot. The sunsets here are absolutely stunning. We walked from the lot to the beach with all our gear. This is a beautiful and secluded beach. I was out here for a photoshoot and the pictures turned out great. Great spot to take a walk or have a picnic.

Je n'y suis allee qu'a une seule reprise pour acheter des sushis pour emporter et je ne crois pas que j'y retournerai. Le service fut courtois, les deux personnes derriere le comptoir etaient certes gentilles et souriantes, mais j'ai du attendre tres longtemps pour obtenir ma commande. C'etait en fin d'apres-midi, avant le rush des soupers et j'etais vraisemblablement leur seule cliente. De plus, je n'ai pas ete impressionnee par la qualite de mes sushis. Sur ma commande, j'en ai laisse environ 14 de cote. Rien pour ravir mes papilles gustatives. Pour des sushis rapides et pas trop chers a Verdun, je recommande plutot Sushi Time sur Wellington ou encore, Aka Fuji pour un repas de qualite!

Sur ma commande, j'en ai laisse environ 14 de cote. Rien pour ravir mes papilles gustatives. Pour des sushis rapides et pas trop chers a Verdun, je recommande plutot Sushi Time sur Wellington ou encore, Aka Fuji pour un repas de qualite!

original_text: I've been to a few other places for dim sum, so my opinion is somewhat biased. For the record, I'm also your standard adventure-seeking gringo, inspired by Andrew Zimmern. So, I'll try anything once, but I'm not the best judge of authenticity, though I can give you a feel for the experience. The hostess is a little shy and unassuming, but she's very friendly. There are two main dining rooms, one on each floor. I started on the upper floor, where I found most of the tables and almost all of the other diners were asian, which is a good sign. There were also several large groups of young asian women, so it's a good place for a ladies night out. I was seated at a booth, and I asked for dim sum. I had a choice of having the waitress roll the cart to me, or having her come up to take my order. I opted for her to come over, and she was right there with pen and paper. She was also very personable, and I got the feeling that she was genuinely interested in helping me. She was very polite, and the whole transaction felt like a casual conversation rather than a business transaction. After I ordered, she thanked me and said she'd be back with my tea. I'd expected to wait a while for the tea, but she was right back. I was impressed. As we waited for the food, the waitress checked on us a couple of times, and made sure that my water was full and that I was enjoying the tea. My tea arrived before the food did, and it was very good. Not too hot, and plenty of flavor. The tea was served in a traditional handleless cup, and the saucer is the large round plate on which the food is served. The tea service was very attractive. The food arrived quickly, and was hot. We had barbecue pork buns, steamed pork dumplings, steamed chicken dumplings, shrimp pork dumplings, and steamed shrimp dumplings. All of the food was excellent. The buns and dumplings were steamed rather than fried, which I prefer. The pork dumplings had a nice sweet flavor, the chicken dumplings were excellent, and the shrimp dumplings were good. I'd call the experience great, not just good. In the lower dining room, I saw the same friendly hostess. She was attending to the whole room, taking orders, and checking on people's tea. The lower dining room was slightly more formal, with table cloths, but the service was the same. All in all, I give this place a thumbs up. The staff was very attentive, and the food was excellent. It's a very clean place, and the decor is pleasant. It's also a very busy place, which speaks for itself. If you're looking for authentic Chinese food, you can't go wrong here. Our family loves the food, and also the service. They do have the best shrimp pork dumplings.

original_text: I took our VW Passat here on Wednesday to get the oil changed. They squeezed me in, and rotated the tires too. Cool. As I was driving to Minneapolis on Friday, however, the plastic bottom covering the engineoil area (or whatever is down there, I don't really know) began to fall off. Eventually, I had to stop at a random dealership right outside of Eau Claire so that they could remove the rest of the plastic, which had been dragging on the highway. I called Goodyear, and Polly basically said oh yeah, we noticed that the bolts were stripped that hold it on, we shouldn't have put it back on. This is a common problem with VWs, and it's really not a big deal - the plastic isn't necessary for the car, it's just a pain when it actually falls off and drags. What I don't understand is why they put it back on when it was obvious to them that it wasn't going to stay on. So now it's back at Goodyear for the day. They are putting a new cover on, for free of course.

The house Bloody Mary is very good, but I asked them to make it for me with hot sauce instead of the horseradish they usually put in it. I am very glad I did that because it really made a difference. This is my favorite Bloody Mary in Baton Rouge. I have tried many of them, and I still have some to go, but this is my favorite so far. I also had a dessert which is not on the menu. I asked for an off the menu dessert, and I am really glad I did. It was called a Nutella Bread Pudding, and it was amazing. I will say that our server was not the best I have ever had at Sonoma Grille, but I was still very satisfied with my meal. The other thing I will say is that I really like the atmosphere at Sonoma Grille. I love the high ceilings and the modern decor. original_text: Il Mulino Staple of NYC and My Hometown comesto Las Vegas in the new section of the forum shops on the North End of the Strip. Everything is pretty much perfect as always, I loved the calamari starter, the steak was very good and so was the service, I cant say enough about this place and it's quality. The wine list is unbelievable with all the regions of Italy represented and it's a place I would recommend to anyone. Il Mulino is a restaurant chain owned by Il Mulino New York, LLC. The Il Mulino restaurants are a part of an international chain of restaurants that are based in New York City. The first Il Mulino was established in Greenwich Village, New York, in 1981 by Abruzzese immigrant Fernando Gaglio, and his sons Roberto and Andrea Gaglio. The restaurant had previously existed as La Mela Ristorante and was purchased by the Gaglios in 1981. The Il Mulino menu was designed to reflect the cuisine of Abruzzo, Italy, the home of the Gaglios. The menu was developed by the Gaglios in consultation with Gino Filippone, an Italian chef from the Abruzzo region. In 1987, Gino Filippone, Roberto Gaglio and Stephen I. Sadove opened a second Il Mulino in New York City, located in the affluent suburb of Greenwich, Connecticut. In 1993, a third Il Mulino opened on Restaurant Row in New York City. In 1994, Il Mulino opened at the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Nevada. text: Is there a smoking area in the restaurant at the top of the hill at the bottom of the road at the junction with the M4 and the M62?

original_text: Terrible service. They were rude over the intercom, didn't listen and hung up on us before we were finished. Never had such a hard time at a drive through. The woman who spoke with us over the intercom would not take our order because we wanted to change the drinks from the drink combo. I have never had this problem before and now I know not to go back to this location. I had a great experience with the lady who took my order at the drive thru. She was very friendly and helpful and I thought that was great. The order was wrong and they didnt want to fix it. I ordered a grilled chicken salad. I asked for no onions, no tomatoes. I got an onion on it, so I called to complain. They said they would comp it. I also ordered a muffin, which was not toasted. They did not comp that. I went to pick up my new salad. I got it home and it was still wrong. The onion was still on it. I was very upset. The salad was not grilled. I like it grilled. I was not happy at all. This is the 2nd time I have been given the wrong food from this location. Ordered the Sweet Apple Crunch salad with the chicken breast on top of it instead of crispy chicken strips. Also asked for no tomatoes, but still got some. This location always has a long drive through line. Ordered a butter pecan latte and they forgot the butter in my order. Ordered a chocolate muffin and received a blueberry muffin instead. I was served at the drive thru and my food was cold and burnt. My chicken was not grilled as requested but charred on a grill, it looked as if it had been stuck to the grill. The person who took my order was not very friendly.
text: I have been to this restaurant a few times and have never had such a bad experience as I have had today, I will definitely not be going back.

original_text: Luckily we learned about the small taco shop on Groupon. We drove past the Glendale location and we thought it was closed. Had to call to double check the hours. Once we walked in, we were greeted by the manager or owner, very welcoming. He offered us some chips and guacamole. Came to find out there was no refill on chips and we had to pay for the guacamole.... I would have liked to enjoyed some chips throughout my meal, not just the first 10 minutes. Me and my boyfriend don't drink soda, so he offered a drink we took water. He brought us the water, but in a PLASTIC CLEAR CUP. Like the ones Circle K gives you. However the tacos we ordered were AMAZING. I had the Carne Asada street tacos. They were delicious. We ate and talked. about 20 minutes later, still no waiter for a refill. I had to get up and walk to the bar for more water. Finally the check comes.... we paid in cash and we had decided what the tip was going to be. The change came and the waitermanagerowner took some of the change as his tip.... So if you can get past the bad service, getting offered something that should be free, small plastic water cups, then you'll have a great meal. We're going to go again, but to the other location.

original_text: The Spice Market buffet was really disappointing. The shrimp, wild mushroom stew, strawberry cream cake and bread pudding were the only redeeming dishes. The crab legs had the frozen seawater taste (at least they were pre cut) and most of the fish in the seafood section were dried out, frozen fish. The grape rolls in the Middle Eastern wasn't even edible. The deserts were marginally better. It was definitely a cop out to have so many cupcakes instead of real deserts. Glad I got a groupon and didn't pay full price for it.

original_text: Came here to celebrate my brothers engagement. The place was very busy, but the servers were still very attentive and friendly even with all the chaos going on. The decor of this place is really cool. I always like dim lit places. There were about 25 of us, but they were very accommodating. The food was very good. For a franchise place they had some good stuff. What really stood out was the chicken saltimbocca it was probably the biggest hit at the table. I will be back for that dish. The whole night was great they really did a great job with everything.

original_text: So.... although I was celebrating my 25th in Vegas..... and it was my first time- I have to say that I had a great time and I didn't stay on the strip the whole time. First off, I stayed at the Flamingo- and I loved it! I got a great deal at 65 a night and it was such a beautiful hotel. The pools were great (although I wish I had more time to enjoy them) and the food was good too. I went to the Bella Vita Italian Restaurant there and it was actually very good. I got the fettucini alfredo and I was so full that I had to take half of it home! My first night there I met up with a friend who I met online and we went to the Mirage and saw Cirque du Soleil's LOVE which was awesome! It's a Beatles tribute of sorts with the Cirque du Soleil twist. I really enjoyed it! I also liked that it wasn't so over-the-top. I guess I'm not a fan of the "Vegas" show in general. Then the next day I headed to Fremont Street for the Fremont Street Experience. It was amazing. I went during the day and then came back at night and it was amazing. There is a show every hour on the hour on the canopy on the street and there are bars everywhere. I had a great time and I was able to get my name on the "Walk of Stars." The only thing I really didn't like was that the city is so spread out. I mean, you have to drive everywhere and if you're not careful you could spend a lot of money on taxis! So, be careful. But, I had a great time. I loved walking the strip (I did it 3 times) and I just had a great time.
text: Last week I went to Las Vegas for a birthday party and it was such a great time. My first night there I met up with a friend who I met online and we went to the Mirage and saw Cirque du Soleil's LOVE which was awesome!

original_text: This is the old Rigatony's on Brown Rd- If you've never been, it has a Buca di Bepo-ish, before Buca was cool, sort of feel. They even serve their house wine in a coffee cup! They had been there since 1954, but the owner decided to retire. Citing issues with the landlord, the owner put a sign on the door stating that they were closed for renovations. They had previously told the landlord they were going to retire. They did a quick "renovation" that consisted of screwing a piece of plywood over the windows with the word "closed" on it. If you walk up to the building, there is nothing out of the ordinary, it just looks closed. The building is owned by the City of Canton. The city acquired it when they expanded the road. The city then sold the building to the current landlord. The landlord is a private citizen. He also owns the parking lot the restaurant is on. He has a lease with the city to rent the parking lot. The restaurant owner is now suing the landlord. He alleges that the landlord is keeping him from doing business and is interfering with his lease with the city. I find it interesting that the restaurant owner's lease with the city is worth more than his lease with the landlord, but he chose not to renew the lease with the landlord.

original_text: In hopes that TGI's would bring a little more to the table then what Sam's Town puts out...wishful thinking. I would much rather head out to the food-court, order a Big Mac and watch that howling wolf, then to spend 30 at this place again. I have generously given them an extra star due to the major crisis our server claimed they were experiencing during our visit. Needless to say, it took a good while to get menus, and twice as long to get drink orders in. We ordered Buffalo Wings from their Happy Hour. Wings were cold and had an odd flavor. The fries came later when we were almost finished eating our Wings. They were SO salty, we ended leaving the entire basket. Our Mozzarella sticks were delicious, and earned a whole whoopin star for great taste and freshness!! Cheese was fresh and stringy, just like a cheese stick should look. Other than our cheese sticks, everything about this location was below average.

original_text: My fiance and I came into this Walmart and famished we decided since there was a sonic and we've been mcdonalds'd out we would try something different so we ordered some foot longs. we ordered them at 7:45 and we got them at 8:15. when we got them to the car we were shocked at how much our food looked like the picture. we were very excited to eat because we were starving at this point. so we started off with the jalapeno popper and it tasted good. very good. we moved on to the philly and it was great. the meat tasted fresh and it was filling. we moved on to the bbq and it was a hit. we both like bbq chicken but most restaurants we go to the chicken is not cooked enough and has a certain taste to it. we both were very pleased with the bbq chicken. when we got to the chicken salad we were excited to see it was still cold and it tasted great. the chicken was good and the lettuce was fresh and crunchy. we had a good experience with the food and the food tasted great! we will definitely be coming back.
text: I'm writing to tell you about my experience at the new sonic fast food joint in Voorhees, New Jersey, and how it turned out for me.

original_text: For a place open just a matter of weeks The Spot seems to be off to a great start. We arrived to a full house on Saturday evening and settled onto some stools at the bar to enjoy a beer before a table was ready for us. The bar selection was good and the bartender was enthusiastic and welcoming. Built within an old house, The Spot is small; there were only about 10 tables and about 4-6 spots at the bar. Rumor has it there is some outdoor seating but it was a bit too chilly to take advantage of that! They aren't currently taking reservations but who knows if that will change down the road. The ambiance is quite nice; freshly done woodwork, soft lighting, and lined with black white photos on the dark red walls. If I had my choice, the best seats in the house are probably in the bar area or the booths up by the front windows. Two of the booths are right by the kitchen window which has pros and cons; some people love seeing behind the curtain and watching the action. I, on the other hand, find fluorescent kitchen lights to be my kryptonite so I'd rather stick to the more romantic corners of the space. The menu had many tempting options on it for both the vegetarian and the carnivore. Prices were reasonable and a lot sounded tasty. We started with the Baked Artichoke Remikin (6.50) which was served with pickled carrots and crusty bread. We enjoyed it thoroughly; it was a good portion for two or three. For entrees I had the Portabella stew (11) which I enjoyed and the Mister settled on the Wild Boar Sausage (14) and was also pleased. Portions were fair sized, enough for dinner for each of us, not really enough to take home for lunch the next day. Both entrees were served with a side of cooked greens and polenta. The greens were good, the polenta was so salty even Mr.-High-Blood-Pressure himself wasn't interested. This is where The Spot's interest in customer service became evident: our server noticed both of us were bypassing the polenta asked for feedback, which we provided. He did say the kitchen team is still tweaking things and trying to improve everything, of course, so they appreciate hearing customer's thoughts on the food. (Well, you know we're not shy!). We provided feedback on the polenta but assured him that overall they seem to be in great shape. A few minutes later, the owner offered us a complimentary dessert due to the polentapalooza. Yum! Dense chocolate cake, rich and sweet, a perfect end to the meal. I liked the cozy space, it looks like they'll have some fun specials during the week, there were several things that tempted me on the menu, parking was easy, prices were reasonable, service was great.... all in all, we look forward to heading back again.

original_text: Three of us gals celebrated our birthdays here, what a great decision. None of us had ever painted anything other than walls or stick people. We worried for nothing, the instructor gave such clear step by step directions. We were assured that there almost nothing we could do that would ruin our painting, and she was right! We were all treated to a wonderful little birthday dessert that tasted like a little piece of heaven. We didn't know they served food and had eaten prior. Next time we'll try something from the menu. A good time was had by all, we will be back.

original_text: I guess I am not in the Trailhead club. Walking into a new place can sometimes be a bit awkward. Where to go, where to stand, seat yourself or not, these things are not always evident. So I walk into the Trailhead Cafe, not knowing what to expect. All I know is that it marries my two favorite things: Bicycles and Food. It is Sunday morning and a breakfast sandwich soundas great. Ok Cut to the chase. I actually never ate at this cafe. I could not get sanyone to greet me, let alone take an order. I walked in slowly - trying to get a bearing on this new joint. I took the universal stance infront of the food counter, which suggest I might want to order something. A young man after a few minutes showed up behind the counter, made eye contact and did not say a single word to me. Ok - so he was busy, I never want to be that guy. He proceeds to chat with a couple of friends. I figured I would look at some of the kool bikes and let him finish. After a poilite trip around the shop (on my part), I went again to the counter and took that universal pose of I am ready to order now. 2 or 3 people walk past me, and not a word. I figured, I was not part of the Trailhead scene and sheepishly made my way for the exit. 15 minutes wasted and still no food or drink. Now - I know that this must be an anomalie as fellow yelpers like this joint. I gotta say that this put a bad taste in my mouth (really no taste at all). I will probably go back and give it a try. I hope I have a better experience. This definately falls under the category of a hasty response, but hey businesses go down all the time because of this type of negligent service. It is a competitve market out there and every guest is huge. Hope my second try, whenever that may be, goes a bit better. A

original_text: I don't understand what is the hype about this place. Based on the ratings, I decided to try it myself. I got the chicken and waffle breakfast and my husband got the short ribs. We both thought that the food was just mediocre. I was disappointed with the breakfast. My husband loved the short ribs, but that's it. He was bored with the rest of the meal. It wasn't a bad experience, but we wouldn't go again.

original_text: This place is actually a new fancy Mc Cafe. Inside looks like a starbucks with wood finishes, pendant lights and wood flooring. VERY NICE for a McDonalds. We just ventured in today to check out the new menu items and what we found was FANTASTIC. I ordered the Jalapeno Mac and Cheese, my daughter had the chicken fajitas and my husband had a sausage McGriddle. It was all delicious and I will definitely be going back. The Mac and cheese was a little more than I wanted to pay at 5.99 but it was cheesy and gooey and not disgustingly greasy like most fast food mac and cheese. My daughter loved her fajitas and my husband loved his sausage McGriddle. The service was great and the staff was friendly.

original_text: Thoroughly enjoyed my night here tonight! Right when we walked in it was super packed. We couldn't find our own seat in the bar area so moved on to the dining area for 8 people. The zipparita is actually very good for the happy hour at only 3. When it says there's a limit on the menu, I knew I would get my money's worth of alcohol. When we ordered food, we got the mild buffalo wings and the chips and guac..... Not a bad wait for both of the items with how busy it was. The buffalo wings in mild were way too bland for me so we had to get a side of medium sauce for the extra kick. For the chips and guac, both very good but had to a season the guac with much more salt and pepper. For the rest of the night it was just more drinks. For it being March Madness, I would love to be back here again during this week. A great place to watch games as TVs are absolutely everywhere. Keep up the nice work as a new sports bar on Mill and people will continue to come in! Be back soon!

original_text: Having already visited the Home Hardware store in Morningside, I was expecting to find more of the same at their sister store in Portobello. I was pleasantly surprised to see that this store offers much of the same and more. Firstly, this place is very large. I just about managed to fit it all into the photo! It covers everything that you could possibly need for your home. There's paint, DIY equipment, plants, home accessories and furnishings and more besides. They also provide a delivery service, meaning that there's no need to trek out to a BQ or Homebase, when a place as big as this is probably just on your doorstep. Honestly, I was impressed with this place. It crams in a lot of stuff, and will succeed in dragging people away from the big chains to something more local. These people are definitely getting it right in my opinion.

original_text: Well, my faith in Claim Jumpers has restored! We had a group function today, serving our local support team. Our appetizers came out before our meal and we were given extra bread. Our waiter was awesome and even though we were a large group, he made sure we were taken care of. We ordered from the special menu, which was the only way I was going to eat there. One of our guests ordered a regular menu item, the steak. He took one bite and it was over-cooked. He sent it back. His second steak came out on fire and blackened all over. He sent it back. His third steak came out and was perfect. When they brought the bill, they did not charge him for his steak. The manager was apologetic and very concerned about the situation. The manager also took care of the person who did not get his appetizer, because it came out cold. He ordered it again and this time it was perfect. I will go back, but only on the special menu. If you go on a regular day, I would think twice about it. I have never been to Claim Jumper, but I have been to Black Angus, Outback, and Texas Roadhouse. I'll have to give Claim Jumper a try. I love a good steak! I have never been to Claim Jumper either. I have been to Black Angus, Texas Roadhouse, Outback, and a few others. I have never eaten at a Claim Jumper. I don't really enjoy chain steak houses though. I think the last chain steak house I ate at was in 1995. My husband and I went to Claim Jumper for the first time last week. It was great. I had a Chicken sandwich that was great. I don't remember what the special was but it was very good. I would go back again.

original_text: Just had a very memorable experience her this past weekend. We made a reservation and my boyfriend asked that since it was a date to make is special. When we arrived, they sat us right away at a round banquette that overlooked the entire restaurant from the back of the room. Perfect location. The interior was festive but collected and calm at the same time. Very tastefully done. We went there specifically for the tasting menu, which my boyfriend had had before and loved. It was the most impressive meal I've had, not just because of the food but because we were served by a TEAM. There was the bread guy, the busser guy, the wine guy, and the main server. They could not have been more polite, attentive, or friendly. thinking we were jsut getting tastes of wine parings for each dish, we started out with a bottle of white but we sure didn't need it - each pairing was a full glass of the most perfect wine. The wine guy (our own personal sommolier) gave a description of each after pouring, and the only complaint was that he was soft spoken so we had a hard time hearing him. They were all probably a bunch of adjectives anyway, we're not wine snobs so we didn't care too much. I had to try real hard not to till up with each dish, knowing there was more to come - 8 dishes in all. God, it was SOOOOO good. After that I was so full of wine and stuffed with incredible food I just went back to our hotel and zonked out!;-P For anyone looking for a memorable dining experience, there's lots of celebrity chef restaurants out there but this one was really worth it. The bill came out to about 300 for two with tip, I believe (i just glanced at it as he opened it) Not bad at all.

original_text: My husband and I have been here several times already and like this place. We have always been greeted promptly at the door seated quickly. We have had Kaitlin several times as our server and she is great. She is very friendly, knowledgeable, and takes care of your needs. They have a large menu with something for everyone. I tried the Pineapple Mojito it was great. I had the Ribeye dinner and it was good. I had the Mashed Potatoes with Gravy as a side it was good. My husband had the NY Strip Steak with the Mashed Potatoes and Gravy as a side and he really liked it. Our friends had the Chicken Pot Pie and the French Dip sandwich and they enjoyed it. We have tried the onion rings as an appetizer and they are good. They have a nice dessert selection. I had the Ice Cream Cake and it was great. My husband had the White Chocolate Bread Pudding and he said it was really good. The prices are not bad for what you get. They have a large bar area if you are not wanting to sit in the restaurant. We will be back to try something else.

original_text: We got here before opening (they open an hour after the preserve opens) and were completely ignored by several people who walked past us. Wolfgang, here's some helpful tips to make your place better. Your sign on the door says you open at 9:00. You shouldn't open until 9:15. Your doors aren't sealed all the way. They are open a crack. You should try to get them sealed so that the air conditioning isn't wasted. Also, the windows in the lobby have several dings and scratches in them. You should fix them. The same for the scratches in the walls. The floor of the lobby isn't leveled very well. The wallpaper is a bit crooked in places. There was some crap in the hallway. If you can't be bothered to take care of your place, at least get your workers to keep it clean. We didn't stay for a haunt. We're not going to pay to have someone walk around and scream in our ears. It's not worth the money. And we're not going to wait in a 15 minute line for a 30 second haunt. We can scare ourselves at home for free. Patron Flow Inside Attraction: It was fine. We didn't run into anyone else. Appropriate Ages: 16, I guess. Props Special FX: The actors were the best props. They really got into their roles. original_text: This place does one thing good and that is chicken strips! I do not think they'll mind me saying this. Prices are very reasonable. The strips are amazing for fast food! I've been to their other locations and this store on their second or third day. Raising Cain's has some impressive quality standards in-place. Every location I go to I am always served juicy chicken strips and the staff are trained well to assure that you will have excellent customer service. I'm going on a limb here and am declaring these chicken strips the best fast food has to offer.

original_text: Best automotive experience I've ever had. My car's check engine light was on and instead of charging me an arm and a leg to fix a problem I might not have (a new converter), they walked my car through the steps that led to the problem and fixed it (a bottle of seafoam in my gas tank to clear out my sensors). They were friendly, helpful and fair.
text: Best automotive experience I've ever had. My car's check engine light was on and instead of charging me an arm and a leg to fix a problem I might not have (a new converter), they walked my car through the steps that led to the problem and fixed it (a bottle of seafoam in my gas tank to clear out my sensors). They were friendly, helpful and fair.

original_text: Moxie Java is a recently-opened little corporate-style coffee shop with a small lunch menu and some deserts. Consider it Starbucks (plus) better coffee variety than Starbucks, wider menu, and wider selection of desserts. Let's get the important details out of the way: thumbs up on the coffee. They brew multiple varieties of coffee light roast, medium roast, dark roast, and flavored. It's nice to have a choice downtown (since workers have been stuck with the burnt swill put out by Starbucks for year). They also carry frozen, blended coffee and the barista will make a tasty mocha or latte. Prices are pretty much Starbucks level (2.25 for a medium cup of coffee). It's nice to have a sittin' place downtown. The ambiance is corporate comfortfake hardwood floors, wooden chairs, fake fireplace. The place is clean, the tables have space to work, and there's a few comfy chairs to sit in and read. A plus is the free Wifi. The food ain't bad. The bakery products are freshthe muffins are tasty (they'll also offer to warm it up for you). There's a light lunch menu too (wraps, bagel sandwiches). I've had the club wrap and it's pretty well put together (bacon: crispy. turkey: fresh. lettuce: fresh). They have a daily soup as well: decent-enough. The real score with this place is that they offer gelato. Ice cream for lunch! Score! It's nice to have another cafe downtown. There are few enough places to get food.

The real score with this place is that they offer gelato. Ice cream for lunch! Score! It's nice to have another cafe downtown. There are few enough places to get food.

original_text: Great ice cream however service was poor. I was number 3 in line and the cashier just wanted to chat with everybody. When my turn came around she told us to hold on as she disappeared into the back for a couple minutes. Upon returning (only employee there), she wasn't too quick and at that point a line formed with 6 more people behind us just as irritated. I know a couple people took pictures of their phone number to call in a verbal complaint.

original_text: Came for brunch, looked empty on the outside but was surprised to find that the place was full of people upon entering! I came on a Saturday about noon, I thought the food was good. The eggs benedict were well-executed and the portion was generous. The salmon was on the well-done side but overall was good. I think we did the right thing coming for brunch instead of dinner as the dinner menu looks a bit on the overpriced side. I'd come back for brunch and will be willing to give the dinner menu a try.
text: The eggs benedict was well-executed and the portion was generous, the salmon was on the well-done side, but the dinner menu looks a bit on the overpriced side.

original_text: I hate writing bad reviews but this seriously warrants it. Maybe other Lowes are better but this particular store just fails. Management hides behind their employees and don't own up to their own mistakes. It's never their fault. And no one ever knows anything. They always say we'll get back to you. Well, I have yet to have one single person ever get back to me with anything that I have asked. They lie and tell you they don't have anything in stock and then when you go to a competitors store you find that they have exactly what you were told they didn't have. They lie about when you can pick up an order and then when you show up they tell you it will be another hour. The list goes on and on. I've worked in retail before and if my management team had done anything remotely close to how Lowes treats their employees and customers I would have been fired. I'm not sure how these people keep their jobs.

original_text: Mandalay Bay does not disappoint. Although I always stay at this hotel, this past weekend we tried one night at Mirage and 2 at MB - let me tell you, after one night we made the switch. The rooms were much nicer, the casino was much nicer, the bathroom was much nicer, and the bed was much nicer. So, if you're going to Vegas, stay here! You won't be sorry! Mandalay Bay has the most beautiful rooms of any hotel I have stayed at in Vegas. The bathroom is beautiful and has a great shower. I love the tub and it's windows overlooking the room. There are also lots of lighting options. The rooms are spacious, and the staff was helpful. The staff and customer service at the hotel is what keeps me coming back! Great hotel, beautiful casino, awesome pool, great restaurants, and the rooms are awesome!

original_text: This is your standard Chick-Fil-A - consistently good food with friendly staff. This Chick is located off of South Blvd in the same shopping center as a movie theater, Target, Old Navy, Bed Bath Beyond, Kohl's, Michaels and a bunch of other stuff. The traffic pattern in the center can be a bit of a cluster, but isn't that true of most shopping centers? Coming through a little before 11:30 am on a Thursday, I drove straight up to the call box, ordered my 1, quickly paid and was on my way. The condiments I requested were in the bag, the lack of pickles that I requested was honored and my tea was perfectly sweet. Eat mor chikin!

original_text: So.... although I was celebrating my 25th in Vegas..... and it was my first time- I have to say that I had a great time and I didn't stay on the strip. The staff is great and we were greeted with a smile and 2 warm cookies! There is a shuttle that runs to the MGM every hour- so that was quite helpful! Saved me and the BF about 60 in taxi fares. It'll run about 20 from the strip back to the D.T. They have an applebee's on site- pretty cool.... especially when you don't want to pay to go anywhere.... Although they did have a cafe in the lobby..... I didn't get a chance to check it out. Anywho- they have a nice workout room and small pool..... for the price and convienence- not bad at all!

original_text: After hearing how terrific the food and atmosphere are at Tornado Club, I was eager to try it. I had the 8 oz filet and my girlfriend had the queen cut of prime rib on a recent Saturday night. Even though the restaurant is listed as wheelchair accessible, it was difficult to turn the sharp corner into the bar from the front door and if the bar is busy, it's nearly impossible to negotiate my large power wc between the vintage barstools and excessively large booths. Also, the well-worn marble in the doorway needs to be replacedit forms a large, uneven surface which further complicates a difficult entryway for a wheelchair-using patron. My steak was good, if slightly undercooked from my medium request. The hash brown were greasy and overly cooked and my underwhelming barley mushroom soup was heavy on the former while the latter was nearly non-existant. My gf's prime rib was tasty, but the cut was particularly thin and excessively fatty compared with other restaurants in Madison. Overall, Smoky's still rules in my book and perhaps it's impossible for any steak house to live up to the kind of love the Tornado gets from it's devotees. It just didn't do it for me and Smoky's doesn't make you choose between soup or salad (both are included) and each include a relish tray and breadfor pretty much the same price. For me though, the flavor of my steak wasn't as good as Smoky's and it was disappointingly undercooked. I'm probably like most diners who don't go to the trouble to send it back, not wanting to wait or make a fuss.

original_text: I'm going to write one last review on FastMed, as if the two previous ones weren't clear enough. Yes, I had an incredibly horrible experience there...fine, lesson learned. I found a new primary care physician and moved on. But I was shocked to discover that FastMed had added a 200 charge to my credit card for an overdue bill. I was not aware of this, because they never even contacted me to tell me that they were charging my card, or to tell me that they were sending my "unpaid bill" to a collection agency. A few days after I left my final review, I discovered that FastMed had been charging my credit card on a monthly basis for the past 6 months. I couldn't believe it. So, I called the collection agency, explained the situation, and asked that they please remove the charges. "We can't do that, it's FastMed's mistake." Oh, so I'm expected to pay for a 200 mistake? Is that how that works? So, I called FastMed, and I spoke with a manager who was incredibly rude, arrogant, and unprofessional. I explained to her that they had been charging my card without my permission, and I was shocked. She told me that I signed a waiver that allows them to do that. Well, I never signed any waiver, and even if I did, that doesn't make it right. She also told me that I was rude to her, and that she would be happy to put me on hold, while she and her staff have a good laugh at my expense. She then hung up on me. I called back, and she refused to speak to me. So, now I'm stuck, and I'm not sure what to do. I guess this is one of the downsides to the new health care system, but honestly, I don't know what to do. They don't care, and they're not going to help me, and I don't know what else to do. So, I guess I'll just pay the 200, and I'll never step foot in there again. But I will tell everyone I know to stay as far away as possible. I know they're not supposed to be there for emergencies, but I didn't know that when I went, and I was just desperate to get some help. I was referred there by my old primary care physician, so I assumed that it was a good place to go. They're very sneaky, and if I had known, I never would have gone there. If you do need to go, I highly recommend that you pay with cash.

original_text: I am not usually a fan of buffets but before heading to Las Vegas I took some time to read about several places that were of note, especially within my hotel. Wicked Spoon was apparently one of them. Not your traditional buffet, the portions were individual and of fantastic quality. No spooning your eggs out of a mass vat here or harsh heat lamps. For example; look at the above mini eggs benny!? Each table was given a large glass bottle of Aquahealth water and of course unlimited coffee, juices etc and if you paid a bit extra, unlimited mimosas, bloody mary's or champs! I am a sucker for miniature versions of things..the takeout boxes they put the asian cuisine in were no exception. Also offered: korean bbq, miniature fried chicken drumsticks that come in your own little fryer basket, prosciutto pizza, duck confit ravioli with sage (sweet and savory perfection) beet and arugula salad and so much more. I loved that even though it was morning there were excellent lunch options which I sampled without holding back (it was for research!) Other dishes of note: the chicken apple sausage was heavenly, mini croissants, hash, fruitcheese bar, sausage station in general, asian fusion area and a carving station. I had read that Wicked Spoon previously did not have labels on everything to encourage conversation about the food. That has since changed which made things pretty convenient. The service was impeccable - I would return indefinitely and recommend it highly if and when you return to Vegas next!
