We called in our order and were told it would be ready in 20 minutes. 10 minutes before the games started, we called in to see where our food was, they told us we would have it in 10 more minutes. 30 minutes later we decided to pick it up because we had games to get to, when we got there the girl at the counter was talking to her friend and we had to wait to order. When I asked about the pizza she told us it had just gone in the oven and would be another 10 minutes. When it finally came out, there were no drinks, she went to get them, took a long time, we were late for the games, and I went to pay for the pizzas and the girl said we had been charged extra for cheese and told me to ask my husband what we ordered, which I did, he said he didn't ask for extra cheese. Then she charged me for 2 drinks for my 2 kids, when I told her I was only given one, she told me that was why I was charged for 2, I told her I only had 2 kids and I could only use 2 drinks and I wanted a refund, she gave me the refund but I will never go there again, the girl at the window was very rude and the whole experience was very unpleasant, especially since it was my kids first time playing in their baseball games. I will not recommend anyone to this place. Great food. The girl at the counter was very sweet and made sure my order was correct.

original_text: Had a business lunch there today, and definitely will not be returning for the food. I heard whispers about town that the food at this Vig was going to be better than their other locations. So, I was excited to give this one a shot, as I have totally given up on their other locations for anything other than drinks, and light snacks. The outside eating area and bar are just perfect for the fall weather. The design is simple, cohesive, friendly warm. The praise stops there. We ordered chips guac. The chips tasted like they were fried in old oil, and the guac had a flavor that certainly wasn't guac-licious.... more on the verge of going bad. One person joining us had the deconstructed tacos, which she barely touched, as the fish was more like fish jerky, and the side of beans totally tasteless. I shared the best turkey sandwich with someone, and had high expectations with a name like that. It was a soggy mess of flavors. None of the ingredients stuck out, and it quickly fell apart after the first bite. Nothing was exceptional. Sort of bummed by the experience, but at least it will be a fun place to grab a beer on a lovely fall evening.

original_text: We went for a second time (found out later it was 2 weeks after the chef departed). Surf and turf roll - tasteless. Fried rock shrimp - OK Sent the dessert back, as they may have made the donut part to order, but then filled it with almost frozen yuzu creme. It's really a shame, as I like the concept and it's close to where I live.... let's hope the next chef whips it back in shape.

original_text: I must say.... Arby's is one if the only fast food joints I go to and my favorite. I live within two blocks. HOWEVER. EVERY time I've been to this location. I'm either told it's gonna be a long wait. Or there's going to be a wait or whatever. I get it. You got a ton of customers and a few employees to keep up. But the last time I came to this place. I waited 30 mins to be told that they just stopped making the item I ordered because they're so busy. I'll be honest I've had it. I'm not a picky person at all. I literally just want my food. And it's not a big deal. But this Arby's is so busy that they don't even know how to handle it. When I go to arby's I'm looking for the best roast beef in town and they deliver! If you're looking for something a little different try the Smokehouse Brisket sandwich! It's to die for! This Arby's is the best one in the whole city. The service is great and the food is perfect. Absolutely the best place to eat in town. Very nice and courteous staff and always a pleasure to visit!

original_text: My wife and I had breakfast here on a Monday morning before our flight home. We got seated immediately and had fast, happy service, and that's where the enjoyable portion of this review ends. The food was mediocre at best, and after having dined in Le Village Buffet next door I'm certain they share the same kitchen. This means you're paying more for your single serving breakfast that you would be paying the 15 for the buffet. I suppose if you really wanted to avoid the lines at the buffet and didn't mind shelling out for each glass of juice you wanted this would be alright. We'd dined at the buffet on Saturday morning and felt the lines (that really weren't that bad) would be worth waiting on rather than pay a premium for the same food.

original_text: I have been here multiple times before and thought it was pretty good. Over time I have noticed a slight slip in quality of the food. This last trip for lunch sealed the deal for me and I will not be back. The first floor was about 13 full so it was not too crowded. We were a party of 4. Two ordered burgers and two ordered ribs. One ordered an appetizer that came with the meal instead of before the meal. The worst part was that it took 50 minutes to get our food and once it arrived for two of the people, it took 5 more minutes for the other 2 to get their food. The burgers were tasty as was the cornbread. The ribs were way overcooked and dry and had a slightly burnt taste. My guess is that they were cooked significantly earlier and then reheated on a grill. My collard greens were tough and too salty to eat. Not once during our wait did anyone come by and let us know that the kitchen was behind. No one ever asked how our food was after the wait. There are significantly better places to get BBQ than here.

My only gripe is about the bartender (see ART of Yelp), as I have not forgotten.

original_text: So, the lady and I were in search of some Saturday night food and couldn't decide on what. I had the brilliant idea to get on Groupon and was stuck in between two choices: Rita's and another unnamed Phoenix establishment that we had already been to that is always solid never great. Well, what the hell, let's give Rita's a shot. Nice and conveniently located on 35th and the I-10, we find a spot and get in. Order a few margaritas and they were great. I'm not the world's biggest fan of the marg but Aaron knows how to hook it up. Next, we ordered the table side Guac, I got the Playa Bonita, the lady got the Seafood enchiladas. Everything was OUTSTANDING. I tried her enchiladas and they were dynamite and I had about 4 different kinds of fish that were all cooked perfectly. Service was outstanding, food was fantastic, there was absolutely no reason this place wasn't jam packed on a Saturday night. I suggest you go support a local business that does things right. I love Pappadeaux as much as the next guy and can say that Rita's stands just as tall next to them in service and food quality. You won't get the white tablecloth but you will have an extra 50 in your pocket when you leave and be just as satisfied.

I guarantee you'll enjoy eating at this place, but make sure you've sent your spouse or significant other to the Benecol booth for a free cholesterol test first. original_text: Oh Caps. I used to love you! You upgraded your TV's and downgraded your service. Last year I loved going there for early football games with my family. We'd eat breakfast and watch football. Everyone was so accommodating, and friendly. They would put the game we wanted to see on next to the table we were sitting at. Food was great. Service excellent. This year, totally different story. Last week we went at dinner time for the NFL opening game. The service was horrible. They weren't even busy but our order was wrong, and we got over charged. We thought we'd try again this morning, and again were disappointed. They won't change the channels of the TV's, and they don't play every game. If they don't have your game on you are out of luck. Really a bummer because we used to love this place.

original_text: On the disappointment scale, Italian Grotto ranks right up there with my never getting laid by my first girlfriend, whom I now know twenty years later is a lesbian. Three entrees and I sampled all of them. The marinara dipping sauce was heavy with tomato paste and not at all a good marinara. The clams swam in a broth so salty, it made my lips swell up like a pontoon boat. The fried calamari and artichoke were fried to a delicious, white coloration which, in the realm of fried foods, was about fourteen hues down from golden brown. This created confusion in my already befuddled mind. Was it cooked or wasn't it? I Had to take a bite to solve the mystery. Unnerving. I ordered an antipasto for two thinking I'd go light with meats, cheese, and relishes. Another huge disappointment. It looked like a salad with two buried slices of capicolla deep within and two, also buried, slices of salami. The remainder of the bowl was small bits of red and yellow peppers, about thirty pepperoncini, but mostly romaine tops. This was anything but a traditional antipasto, with the majority of the bowl comprised of lettuce. I don't know why IG hides the meat and cheese, but it pissed me off. I felt like the catcher in a game of hide the salami. Literally! I had to ask for bread since the antipasto was a bust. This made me feel like Oliver Twist begging for crumbs, and for no good reason at 12.95. The only thing good about this place was nothing. I suspect they've remained in business all these years primarily due to their location, and all the unknowing tourists. Never going back.

It looked like a salad with two buried slices of capicolla deep within and two, also buried, slices of salami. The remainder of the bowl was small bits of red and yellow peppers, about thirty pepperoncini, but mostly romaine tops. This was anything but a traditional antipasto, with the majority of the bowl comprised of lettuce. I don't know why IG hides the meat and cheese, but it pissed me off. I felt like the catcher in a game of hide the salami. Literally! I had to ask for bread since the antipasto was a bust. This made me feel like Oliver Twist begging for crumbs, and for no good reason at 12.95. The only thing good about this place was nothing. I suspect they've remained in business all these years primarily due to their location, and all the unknowing tourists. Never going back.

original_text: Interesting experience. Our server was the sweetest thing who dealt with the mix of people on an afternoon where developmentally disabled people (seriously, no joke) demanded a lot of attention. She was on the ball and pleasant and patient. The soup was delicious and the salad bar was average. The food was fine, but when it arrived it was lukewarm at best. Not cold. Not hot. Just lukewarm. The fries were great, but again lukewarm. The service and the staff were great. I agree with the previous review - the food is just ok and the service is sooooo slow. But my grandkids love it so we will keep going there. We were there on a Saturday afternoon. Our server was very nice but very slow. We had to ask for water, and then our soup and sandwich. I had to ask for ketchup and mustard. I wasn't feeling well and didn't feel like waiting. I left to go home and my husband and daughter finished eating. I'm not sure that I would go back.
text: The food is ok, the service is slow, but I'm not sure I'll go back again because I don't feel like it's fast enough.

original_text: I don't understand all these negative reviews. This place is bomb! I got tacos and chips here on my way out of the Palms, and even after my 20 minute cab ride I was able to eat them without being sick. The chips were fresh, and the tacos were fantastic. I just ordered the tacos, because they had steak, chicken, and fish and I didn't know what I was in the mood for. I ended up with steak and chicken. I loved the steak, but the chicken was a little too spicy for me. So if you're not into the spicy stuff, I would suggest avoiding the chicken tacos. Still, an overall great place. I would definitely eat here again.

original_text: Liars!!!!!! Went in this evening to order iPhone 6, when told shipping dates was told that Space Gray 128GB would ship within 24 hours, and 64 GB would be two weeks. I placed the order for 128GB for in store pick up, went home to find out it was never shipped, and is not scheduled to ship until September 12, 2014. So I ordered the 128GB, in space gray, with the 64GB now backordered until September 12, 2014. I then called Apple support and was told that the order I placed was not available for in store pick up. After talking with Apple for about 30 minutes they said that they would cancel the order, refund the money, and reorder. I am now 1 hour 15 minutes into the process, and I am on hold again. I guess that Apple did not have enough of the 128GB model in stock to meet the demand. They should not have allowed me to place the order, and then cancel it. I ordered the 128GB space gray with 64GB of storage in silver. I was told that it would ship within 24 hours, and the date that I should receive it was listed as September 19th. I ordered this on Saturday, September 13, 2014 at 10:45 pm. It is now 10:38 am on September 17th. The order is still listed as preparing for shipment. It is not scheduled to ship until September 19, 2014. I ordered the 128GB space gray with 64GB of storage in silver. I was told that it would ship within 24 hours, and the date that I should receive it was listed as September 19th. I ordered this on Saturday, September 13, 2014 at 10:45 pm. It is now 10:38 am on September 17th. The order is still listed as preparing for shipment. It is not scheduled to ship until September 19, 2014. I also ordered the iPhone 6 64 GB in silver on September 12, 2014. The shipping date on that order is listed as September 26, 2014. It is also listed as preparing for shipment. The order number for the iPhone 6 128GB space gray with 64GB of storage in silver is 27848233745734, and the order number for the iPhone 6 64 GB in silver is 27848194845261. Same here. Ordered silver 6 128gb 1:03am 91314. Order says expected delivery 92014. I called Apple this morning. They said Apple is shipping 25,000 phones a day. I ordered the 6 128gb because I wanted 128gb storage. I have had my iPhone 5 since June 2013, but I didn't want to wait until October for a gold 6. Agreed. I ordered a 128GB space gray iPhone 6 on September 12, 2014 and it is still in the "preparing for shipment" phase. I've also called Apple and was told that they are shipping 25,000 phones per day. That's really sad!
text: Apple's response to customer complaints about the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus has been mixed at best, with some saying Apple should have done more to meet demand, while others say Apple should not have cancelled an order and then backordered it.

original_text: Don't bother. I had an appointment for an oil change on a Saturday afternoon. The appointment was for 2pm. I booked it several days ahead so that I wouldn't end up sitting in the waiting area for a long time. When I made it I specified that I would be waiting, they confirmed day before. I arrived and checked in 1:50pm. At 2:40 I noticed that my car had not even been moved from the place I had parked it. My boyfriend went to ask if they had maybe done it and put it back before we even noticed. They apologized for the wait, and said that it was being done right then, and would be finished in a few minutes. My boyfriend pointed to the car in the lot and asked again if maybe it was finished and they forgot to tell us. Manager- I don't know what the hell those guys are doing out there. He went and talked to the guys in the garage and they did start it a few minutes later. He did not charge for it, and gave me a coupon for half off of the next one. So I have to give some credit for that. The rest of the experience really made up my mind though. First of all, I know it gets busy and a manager needs to be able to trust that his employees will do their job, but this one was not keeping tabs on the employees and they were NOT doing their jobs. They fix people's brakes for a living.The manager is reporting that they have provided service that had not been started. In the hour I listened to the service managers conversations with the customers that were picking their vehicles up, I heard him tell several customers that he had done more work than they had authorized and charge them up to twice what they had been quoted. It was necessary and required for safety reasons. Same crap has been pulled on me and I know better now. I just don't trust them, to the point where I checked my oil that day to see if it had really been changed. It had been.

original_text: Exhausted after a long day of tradeshow-ing, cab lines and not winning a million bucks. It's 8:30pm and we are in line waiting to get into the Wicked Spoon buffet. I'm hungry, my feet hurt, and I am tired. But I will wait in line. I'm just not sure if I can wait this long. Five years ago, my husband and I decided to leave our jobs and take a 12 month around the world vacation. One of the goals we had was to try and be as adventurous with food as possible. After a month in Sydney, we flew to New Zealand. We got there on December 23rd and had a month to drive around the North Island in a camper van. In addition to our list of sites to see, we also had a list of restaurants we wanted to try. It's not a secret that New Zealand has a thriving restaurant scene. Chef Peter Gordon, of London's The Sugar Club and Providores, was born and raised there. He is credited as being one of the first people to introduce fusion food to the UK. We were excited to see if he had influenced any of the chefs we were going to see. Kinloch Lodge was a must on our list. It was a two hour drive from the town we were staying in, and we had to make reservations well in advance. When we got there, the dining room was intimate, warm and cozy. It was a chilly evening and the fire was blazing. The first thing we noticed when we sat down was the variety of servers. They were all young, and they were all dressed in different outfits. It was like they were all going to prom. One of them even had on a tuxedo. We ordered wine and then the parade of food began. The first dish was a warm puffed pastry with a creamy whipped pate. It was salty and smooth and crunchy. The second dish was a fried piece of eel, served on a bed of mashed potatoes. My husband ate it and then looked at me and said, "That's the first time I've ever eaten eel, and I'm not sure I ever want to eat it again." The third dish was lamb. This was different than lamb we had seen in Australia, which was more like a thick roast. This was cut into small pieces, and cooked medium rare. It was served with a red wine sauce. Then came the salad. It was a green salad, and it was the perfect antidote to all the rich and heavy dishes we had just had. It was light and crunchy and refreshing. The cheese course was a selection of three cheeses. One was an aged cheddar from New Zealand, and I can't remember what the other two were. But they were served with dried fruit and nut bread, and a glass of port. Then came dessert. We shared a mango sorbet and a chocolate tart. The sorbet was just the right amount of sweet and tart, and the tart was rich and decadent. We were done. This was a wonderful meal. The service was great, the ambiance was warm and relaxing, and the food was amazing. We left feeling very full and very happy. We went back to the camper van and drove back to our hotel. I was so tired that I fell asleep on the bed while my husband finished unpacking. When I woke up, it was 1:30am. "What time is it?" I asked, looking at my watch. "1:30," he replied, "Why?" "I'm hungry. I just want to go to a restaurant and eat a burger." "Fine," he said, "But I'm not going with you." So I got dressed, and I walked to the restaurant next to the hotel, and I ordered a burger and fries and a glass of beer. And it was wonderful. I don't think I've ever had a better burger, or a better fry. And I was so happy. I'd had the best meal of my life, and the best burger and fry of my life. I think you can have both. Labels: Kinloch Lodge, New Zealand, The Sugar Club, Wicked Spoon Kimberly Atkinson January 25, 2013 at 1:07 AM Very true! This was

original_text: My wife and I went to this office about a year ago for our annual check up. We weren't thrilled immediately. If felt like they were interested only in getting a sale. We decided to give them a chance though and have had our teeth cleaned there twice. The last time we went they told us both needed "deep cleaning." This cost almost 600 per person (total 1200). I don't know if this is legitimate or just a money grab. I had my teeth cleaned recently at a different place. They didn't mention anything about a "deep cleaning" or any other treatment. I think you're better off going somewhere else. Avoid this place like the plague. I'm not sure what to think about these reviews. I can tell you that when I went in for a routine cleaning, they told me I needed a "deep cleaning" as well. They said it had to be done to prevent future problems. They set up an appointment for a week later. When I showed up, I told them I wanted to cancel. They acted like I was crazy, but agreed to cancel. They did try to sell me some sort of add on though. I'm not sure how I feel about this place.

original_text: Two words. ALMOND CROISSANT. It's huge [insert'that's what she said' joke here] and has a good amount of almond filling. So I would try to split it with someone as a snack, or order it with a beverage if you are eating for breakfast. It's a good hearty meal, especially for those that need to keep their blood sugar up. I didn't take pictures of my food, so I'm stealing some from the web. I got the Belgian Waffle. It came with a choice of blueberry or strawberry preserves and whipped cream, which I ordered on the side. This was one of the best waffles I have ever had in my life. It wasn't too heavy, it wasn't too fluffy, the outside was crispy and the inside had a soft, chewy texture. The preserves and whipped cream added a nice sweetness to the waffle. I've had the Eggs Benedict here before, but the last time I went, I wasn't in the mood for eggs. I ordered the Sausage and Peppers with hash browns. The sausage was cooked perfectly, and the peppers and onions were cooked well and were flavorful. I got the Steak and Eggs, and had them cook the steak medium. My friend ordered the Steak and Eggs, and they cooked the steak well-done. He said it was a little chewy, but overall it was still tasty. The service here is always great, and I've never had to wait for a table. They are also open late, so if you have a craving for breakfast food at 2am, they have you covered. I'm so glad I'm not on a diet anymore. Posted by Wandering Chopsticks at 11:33 AM Categories: American, Breakfast or Brunch, Dining, Dining: By City - Westminster, Dining: By Cuisine - American, LA County
text: I've been to this place before, and it's one of the best breakfasts I have ever had in my life, so I thought I would give it a try.

original_text: This would be our second visit to Bouchon, our first being 3 years ago on our 1st wedding anniversary. Boy, I sure forgot about the slow service. To their credit, things went well for about an hour until we were ready for our entrees when we waited...and waited...and waited. Our server walked back and forth, observing my impatient posture and look but never once came over to let us know Oh hey, guys...your entrees will be right out! Okay...now that we have the gripe out of the way, let's get back to the business at hand: Food (in order of appearance) 12 Dz Oysters 1 Dz Mussels - I went with Miyagi oysters which were fresh and briny. The mignonette was my fave condiment for the oysters while the yummy dijonnaise was best for the mussels. The mussels were so good, we ordered another dozen! Cauliflower Soup - topped with fried capers; very rich and creamy and cauliflowery. The capers did much to provide an additional dimension to the otherwise 1D soup. Beet Salad - Red beets topped with some fruit, half crispy with small seeds (like a kiwi). Refreshing! Duck Confit - Served atop halved roasted brussel sprouts. The duck was pure and game-y, as duck confit should be as it's cooked in its own fat. I encouraged my hubby to pick up the bone and gnaw off the crispy parts. Magnificent. Croque Monsieur - served with shoestring fries; appropriately rich with the sauce and sunnyside egg on top but not overly salty like other versions I've had. Gnocchi a la Parisienne - I decided on this dish thinking it would be lighter and make up for all the food we had beforehand. Boy, was I wrong. First off, these aren't potato dumplings. They are pan-fried herbed flour dumplings sauteed with fennel, eggplant and other stuff. I thought it was delicious but the oil at the bottom of the dish indicated it wasn't the light fare I expected. At this point, the 5-6hr drive to Vegas overtook us so we bypassed dessert and requested our check. We realized maybe a long dinner wasn't ideal after we've been on the road for so long! We rubbed our bellies as we headed back to our room for a nightcap and sweet sweet sleep!

original_text: I've been there twice and both times I was surprised at how good it was. The first time I had the falafel sandwich and it was fried perfectly crisp on the outside and bursting with flavor on the inside. The second time I had the gyro platter, which is a mound of shaved gyro meat, pita wedges, jasmine rice and a Greek salad. It was all great, right down to the Tzatziki You might balk at 9 but it's a huge meal, definitely worth it. I also suggest the flavored iced teas that they have. Really, it was all amazing. You could pick this place up and put it in any city and it would fit right in.

original_text: I went here for dinner with my boyfriend and two friends. We all really enjoyed it a lot. My friend ate his Mac and cheese burger so quickly that I almost forgot they even brought it out. I had a burger and it was seriously awesome. The donkey sauce is delicious and I only wish I could have finished that burger because it was so damn good. The drinks were good but a little weak for my liking. The flavors in them are great and very pronounced but it was hard to tell if they were weak or just that the flavors overpowered the alcohol. I really like the decor as well as the sugar skull napkins and nice cutlery. I would definitely hit this spot again on my next Vegas trip and will look into trying one of Guy Fieri's other spots, too.

original_text: Driving to vegas, you can definitely expect traffic. We had dinner reservations at 7:00 and there is a grace period of only 5 minutes.We ran there and got there at 6:55. We were worried that we wouldn't be allowed in but they were awesome about it. The service was really quick so that worked out. They got us our appetizers quickly. Then our main course came out 10 minutes later. I don't think it was fast but I was already full. The food was really good. I had the Caribbean Jerk Shrimp. It was really spicy and was the perfect amount of food. There was a lot of flavor in the sauce. It was a great experience and I would definitely recommend to come here. I've had better jerk chicken but I liked the appetizer a lot. I would come back and try a few more things. We were with a group of 9 and everyone really enjoyed the food.
text: The Jerk House is a really good place to go if you're looking for a good meal in the middle of a busy city like New York.

original_text: Visited with my mother one evening, as Appian Way has been her fave restaurant for many years. It is hard to respect a restaurant that serves cold butter in foil! My dinner started out with the house salad, which was a generous helping of lettuce with cucumber slices and sliced grape tomatoes. I like that they use actual grape tomatoes, rather than the little cherry tomatoes that seem to be the standard with salads. The salad dressing is the standard Italian dressing, but it is really good. I have to say that the most memorable part of my dinner was the toasted garlic bread. I wish I would have been able to buy some to take home with me. My dinner consisted of their Chicken Parmesan. It was a generous portion of chicken that had a nice crispy exterior and a good, hearty marinara sauce. I think I would have been satisfied with just the marinara sauce as an entree. My mom had the traditional Shrimp Scampi. We both had mashed potatoes and broccoli. The broccoli was so good that I would recommend it as a side with anything. I know that it is just broccoli, but it is very tasty. I did not go into the bar area to see what they had to offer. I will have to visit during the day to sample their lunch menu, which is different from their dinner menu. I am sure I will return to sample the toasted garlic bread with some of their other menu items. This entry was posted on Tuesday, July 27th, 2010 at 9:00 am and is filed under Appetizers, Broccoli, Chicken, Dinner, Lunch, Mashed Potatoes, Restaurant, Salads. You can follow any responses to this entry through the RSS 2.0 feed. You can leave a response, or trackback from your own site. 2 Responses to Appian Way Restaurant It has been a long time since I've been to Appian Way. I remember that the place was nice and the food was really good. I had the Shrimp Scampi. It was very good.
text: Appian Way is a popular Italian restaurant on the north side of the city, and it is a shame that they do not have a bar area there.

original_text: I came into a wealth of free bagel cream cheese bagel coupons, so I finally got a chance to check this place out. I'm usually not big on chain bagels, but I'm not going to turn down a free meal either. I tried to go once before but they close at 5pm on Sundays. The sign on the door is lightly confusing since it used to read 6 but the bottom left-hand corner of the 6 was obfuscated in order to make it appear as though it was a 5. I finally made it last week and had a whole wheat bagel with jalapeno cream cheese. The bagel was on par with the standard bagel you can get out of a bag at the supermarket. The jalapeno cheese was delicious and the highpoint of the meal. The people working there were friendly and accommodating. The main hangup was that the worker didn't offer to toast my bagel and, me thinking this would be standard didn't ask, left me with a pretty difficult to eat bagel. After I took one bite I really needed my water to wash down the dense bagel. In NYC you could probably eat untoasted bagels since they are really light and fluffy, but this one was a bit tough to swallow. I feel a conflict of interest when giving them only 2 stars since my bagel was free, but it'll have to remain at 2 until I get my next bagel (also gratis) before the coupon expires.

original_text: I don't understand what is the hype about this place. Based on the ratings, I decided to try it myself. I got the chicken and waffle breakfast and my husband got the man vs. food house special. I was surprised by the portion because their hella huge. Its like a meal for two. I am a big fan of chicken and waffle breakfast but I was not impressed with theirs. First the waffle was soggy so I asked for the waffle to be crispy. When it came back to me, it still wasn't crispy but the server said that's their crispy. I asked for it to be almost burned. I waited patience and started eating my chicken. It was actually good. But reminded me of southern style chicken. I don't care much for it. When the waffle came back, it still was not crispy. So I just gave up on it. I think my husband had the andy's sage fried chicken. It a bunch of stuff on a place. I don't even know where to explain. For me it was ALRIGHT. I would eat it but it was just too much to finish. On the other hand, my husband (who is a chef) did not care for it at all. So that was a total fail. Would I do back again? Probably not. We love good food and appreciate where what we spend our money on. This was just not one of them.

original_text: An absolute must-visit for myself on St. Denis, Arthur Quentin is an exquisitely sophisticated kitchen store for anyone into high quality food-ware and home chefdom and dining. Note that you can also find perfectly reasonable niche cooking utensils etc. along with the pricier things mentioned by the other reviewer. Divided into three linked rooms, the first room is more of an eclectic melange of fabrics, objects, luggage etc. and also quite lovely. The other two are dedicated to cookware and flatware, tableware, glassware, respectively. Friendly, helpful staff who always wrap everything beautifully for presents or otherwise. Equally lovely to browse at the collection of marvels and spend nothing at all. Note that it's the companion store to Bleu Nuit across the street. Also worth a visit for those into linens, bedding and things of the night.

From Business: Voted Best Nail Salon in Sacramento. Located at 4059 Alta Arden Expressway, Sacramento, CA 95825. Open 7 days a week. From Business: We are a nail salon. We offer manicures, pedicures, gel nails, and acrylic nails. We have a tanning bed, waxing, massage, threading, and more. I love this nail salon.
